title: animal_ears
body:
A character with animal ears, real or [[fake animal ears|fake]]. Also known as [i]kemonomimi[/i]. Do not use this tag for pictures of actual [[animal]]s. 

There are two areas where animal ears are usually placed. On top of the head and on the sides of the head (where a human's ears would be). The first type is much easier to [[fake_animal_ears|accessorize]] but anatomically incorrect. The inverse is true for the second type. The first type is most likely to have [[extra_ears|extra human ears]]. For the second type, "extra ears" usually means a redundant accessory.

h4. See also

* [[Ear wiggle]]
* [[Ears down]]
* [[Fake animal ears]]
* [[Hair ears]]
* [[Kemonomimi mode]]
* [[Mismatched animal ear colors]]
* [[Owl ears]] (not actual animal ears)
* [[Tag group:Ears tags]]

title: tiki_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Tiki[/b] (Chiki) is a playable character in several games of the [[Fire Emblem]] series of strategy RPGs. She is the Princess of the Divine Dragon tribe, and therefore much older than she appears to be. She first appears as a 500-year-old child in [[Fire Emblem: Shadow Dragon and the Blade of Light]] and [[Fire Emblem: Mystery of the Emblem]], and reappears [[aged up|as an adult]] 2,000 years later in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] in a [[ponytail]], [[green eyes]] and [[pointy ears]]. [[Tiki_(young)_(fire_emblem)|As a child]], she wears a [[short dress|short]] [[pink dress|pink]] [[dress]], while [[Tiki_(adult)_(fire_emblem)|as an adult]] she wears a short [[red dress|red]] [[strapless dress]] with [[side slit]]s, a pink [[cape]], red [[thigh boots]] over pink [[thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]] and red [[gloves]]. As both a child and an adult she has a [[hair ornament]] above her forehead.

In-game, her class is Manakete, which gives her the power to change into [[dragon]] form in combat via use of a dragonstone.

Remarkably, her Awakening incarnation ended in the Top 1 of the 2022's Edition of "Choose Your Legends":[https://vote6.campaigns.fire-emblem-heroes.com/en-US/result] (women's side).
other_names: チキ(ファイアーエムブレム)

title: kanami_kaito
body:
A former [[Virtual YouTuber]] from [[NEXAS (vtuber)|]]' second generation. Character design by [[Nihakusanren]]. Shares the same designer with [[Faelie Fallwood]] and [[Cora Light]]. Her debut was postponed twice due to personal reasons, in which she ended up debuting on August 26, 2024 instead.

On September 23, 2024, Kanami announced that she would graduate from NEXAS the day after.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[brown hair]] with [[blonde hair|yellow]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[cat ears]], a [[blue hairband]], [[yellow eyes]] and [[slit pupils]].

Her outfit consists of a [[brown]] [[cropped shirt]], an [[open jacket|open]] [[white jacket]] with [[puffy long sleeves]], [[black gloves]], a [[brown bag]] with many items including a [[scale]], a [[lantern]] and a [[scroll]], [[brown pants|brown]] [[puffy pants]], [[white socks]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

title: jeff_albertson
body: Jeff Albertson, commonly known as the Comic Book Guy (CBG), is a recurring fictional character in the animated television series [[The Simpsons]] and Eisner-nominated spin-off comic book series Comic Book Guy. He is voiced by Hank Azaria and first appeared in the second-season episode "Three Men and a Comic Book", which originally aired on May 9, 1991. Comic Book Guy is the proprietor of a comic book store, The Android's Dungeon & Baseball Card Shop. He is based on "every comic book store guy in America" and represents a stereotypical middle-aged comic-book collector with a supercilious attitude and obsessive knowledge of pop culture minutia. He is known for his distinctive accent, disagreeable personality, and his catchphrase, "Worst [thing] ever!"

title: roger_(american_dad)
body: Roger Smith is a fictional character in the adult animated sitcom [[American Dad!]], created, voiced, and designed by Seth MacFarlane. Roger is a grey space [[alien]] living with the Smith family. Having lived on Earth since crashing in Roswell, New Mexico in 1947, Roger came to live with the Smiths after rescuing main character [[Stan Smith]] at Area 51 four years prior to the beginning of the series. The character has also made cameo appearances in episodes of [[Family Guy]].

title: chief_of_ultraseven
body:
A character from [[Ultraseven (series)|]]. His appearance is almost identical to [[ultraseven|Seven]]'s. Famously forgotten by Tsuburaya after his appearance, and never being developed into an actual character like his predecessor in [[Zoffy (ultra series)|]].
 
In "Kazumine Daiji":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%80%E5%B3%B0%E5%A4%A7%E4%BA%8C]'s manga adaptation (and a 2007 short spin-off manga by him), the Chief has a larger and pointier Eye Slugger than Seven's, giving him a mohawk look, and the toy of that design gave him blue eyes as opposed to yellow eyes, to distinguish him from Seven. Before the Chief officially received his name around the time of the "Third Monster Boom":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E7%AC%AC%E4%B8%89%E6%AC%A1%E6%80%AA%E7%8D%A3%E3%83%96%E3%83%BC%E3%83%A0] ([[The Ultraman (anime)|]] and [[Ultraman 80 (series)|]]), he was known as Big Seven (ビックセブン), and due to having similar-meaning names, some fans speculated that Dai Seven (大セブン) from "Tetsuji Kataoka":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%8B%E3%81%9F%E3%81%8A%E3%81%8B%E5%BE%B9%E6%B2%BB]'s manga [i]Ultraseven Monogatari[/i] was the same character as the Chief. Some fans also like to joke he was the actual protagonist of [[Ultra Fight]]'s newly-made fight scenes.

h4. External links

* Ultraman Wiki: "Chief of Ultraman":https://ultra.fandom.com/wiki/Chief_of_Ultraseven

body: Klaus is a character from [[American Dad!]], he was once an East German Olympic ski-jumper until his brainwaves were switched with that of a [[goldfish]] in the 1986 Winter Olympics by the CIA to prevent him from winning the gold medal. title: wolf_cut
body:
A wolf cut is a type of haircut that has more hair volume on top, and thinned-out hair starting at the base of the neck. 

* !post #7351057

A variant of this style has been called the "jellyfish cut" due to its shape - with a rounded "body" (the short layers) and billowy "tentacles" (the longer layers):
* !post #7593315


Do not conflate this tag with the [[mullet]] hairstyle, which is cropped at the [i]sides[/i] of the head (post #5940624).

h4. See also
* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: tamaki_(voisona)
body:
Tamaki is a Japanese vocal synthesizer for [[VoiSona]].

Her voice is provided by [[Inuyama Tamaki]].

"Tamaki" is a character born from the concept of envisioning what would happen if the virtual YouTuber "Inuyama Tamaki" were born female and pursued a life dedicated to singing. Existing in an alternate world line, she possesses a unique visual identity. In contrast to "Inuyama Tamaki," she tends to be more reserved and speaks less. "Reference":https://voisona.com/talk/news_detail/96/

title: cuphead_(game)
body:
Run and gun video game developed by StudioMDHR and released in 2017 for the [[Xbox One]] and PC. It later released on [[Nintendo Switch]] and [[PlayStation 4]] in 2019 and 2020 respectively. A DLC campaign titled "The Delicious Last Course" and a [[Netflix]] animated show released in 2022.

The game is in the style of a [[1930s (style)|]] cartoon, inspired by the works of Max Fleischer and [[Walt Disney]].

The player plays as [[Cuphead]], who fights a series of bosses in order to repay a debt to [[the Devil (cuphead)|]]. The game has been noted for its challenging difficulty.
H4. External links
* "Official website":https://cuphead.iam8bit.com/
* "Wikipedia Article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuphead

title: pyro_(tf2)
body:
[i]I fear no man. But that thing, it scares me.[/i]
--[[Heavy (tf2)|]], talking about the Pyro

One of the playable classes in [[Team Fortress 2]].

An enigmatic, insane, fire-obsessed figure who has never been seen without their full body suit and voice-obscuring mask, the Pyro's name, nationality, [[ambiguous gender|gender]] and even species are a mystery, with the game's developers intentionally teasing the community for years about the truth. Supplementary materials have revealed that the Pyro sees the world in "Pyrovision", where everything is colored with pastels and rainbows, and the Pyro sees themselves merrily bringing joy to others when in reality they're causing untold, horrific suffering. Although childlike, crazy, and terrifying, the Pyro has been shown to act amiably to their teammates on occasion, especially [[Engineer (tf2)|the Engineer]].

The Pyro has average speed and health, and primarily wields a home-made [[flamethrower]], a [[shotgun]] and a [[fire axe]]. They can also use a [[flare gun]], a [[jetpack]], a thrown canister of [[gasoline]], and various alternative versions of each. They're also known for being the natural enemy of [[Spy (tf2)|the Spy]].

The Pyro normally wears a team-colored, full-body fire-retardant rubber suit, a [[gas mask]], large rubber [[gloves]], black belts and boots, and an [[oxygen tank]] on their back.

title: lovebrush_chronicles
body:
[i]Lovebrush Chronicles[/i], known as [i]For All Time[/i] in its native Chinese, is a mobile otome game by PC and mobile game company NetEase Interactive Entertainment. It received an English localization on October 20th, 2023 for Android and iOS devices. 

The player plays as an art major freshman at St. Shelter Academia and the author behind the popular manga "In Passing", who soon finds out that she has the ability to travel to different dimensions and summon her own arts for combat after being sent to Godheim - the world featured in her manga. In these parallel universes, their inhabitants are incarnations of the people from your world. From then on, you embarks on an endless voyage across time and space to learn the truth and protect what you hold dear alongside or against familiar faces. 

The game combines story-driven visual novel with adventure and RPG elements. Outside of the main storyline, the player can spend time with the love interests with various activities or working to increase your reputation in school.  

h4. Main characters
* [[Heroine (lovebrush chronicles)|]]

title: guan_hat
body:
Guan is broad term for any type of hat in of [[Hanfu]] headwear. It tends to cover the full top of the head; for Hanfu headwear that only covers the [[topknot]], see [[Xiao Guan (headdress)|]].

Please see the subtypes and use them instead, as guan is unspecific. 

The Guan was typically a formal form of headwear which was worn together with its corresponding court dress attire. There were sumptuary laws which regulated the wearing of Guan; however, these laws were not fixed; and thus, they would differ from dynasty to dynasty. There were various forms and types of Guan.

As the character Guan (冠) is of a homonym another Chinese character pronounced Guan (官) which literally means official; the Guan (冠) became the symbol of officials. Note, this should not be confused with [[futou]] which essentially replaced the Guan as Chinese court wear around the [[Tang dynasty]] (but continued to be worn by Confucian literati until the [[Ming dynasty]], where it became the exclusive headwear of the royal family).

h4. Subtypes
** [[Fengguan]] - Women's headgear for official events, ceremonies, and weddings
** [[Mian guan]] - Emperor's hat
** [[Xiezhi guan]] - Hat once worn by lawyers.
** [[Yuanyou Guan]]

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: kaguya_luna
body:
[b]Kaguya Luna[/b] is a [[Virtual YouTuber]] who made her debut on December 9, 2017. She was managed by Vic inc. from the start, but between fall 2018 and fall 2019, she operated under her own autonomous agency, [[THE MOON STUDIO]]. In addition to her YouTube content, she produced music under the Sony Music label [[SACRA MUSIC]]. She was designed by [[Mika Pikazo]].

While neither she nor Vic Inc. have officially announced that she had graduated, her most recent YouTube video was published on August 29th, 2020, and the Kaguya Luna Official channel has been inactive ever since. Kaguya Luna's Twitter account has not been active since October 20th, 2020, and as of the end of 2021, the Kaguya Luna Fan Club website has shut down.

Her voice was often compared to [[Hamtaro]], earning her the nickname "Strangled Hamtaro" (首を絞めたハム太郎).

[spoiler][[Pmaru-sama]], who has "admitted":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ADVUKyyq3uA] she is the talent behind Kaguya Luna, remains very active with her own channel on YouTube.[/spoiler]

title: winston_zeddemore
body: Winston Zeddemore, PhD is a fictional character appearing in the [[Ghostbusters]] films, TV series, and video games. He is played by Ernie Hudson in the films Ghostbusters, Ghostbusters II, Ghostbusters: Afterlife and Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire and was voiced by Arsenio Hall in the first three seasons of [[The Real Ghostbusters]]. Buster Jones provided Winston's voice in the remaining seasons, and he reprised the role in a cameo on [[Extreme Ghostbusters]]. Hudson returned to provide his appearance and voice to Zeddemore in 2009's Ghostbusters: The Video Game and 2022's Ghostbusters: Spirits Unleashed.

title: buffering
body:
A common computer graphic consisting of a series of dots, ovals or lines arranged in a circle, and either progressively shaded from light to dark or increasing in size. When animated the formation appears to rotate.

It typically appears when an application is waiting for data (for example, waiting to receive the next few seconds of a streamed video). It can also appear when the system is busy doing something; in this sense it is equivalent to the older spinning hourglass icon.

When applied to a character, it usually indicates:
* an imminent realization regarding a mistake they made or something they forgot
* an inability to fully grasp something that has just happened
* a vacant mental state ("no thoughts, head empty")

h4. See Also
* [[...]]
* [[spoken ellipsis]]
* [[nurupo (meme)|]]
* [[loading icon]]

title: merupo
body:
めるぽ.
A [[meme]] associated with [[Merlin Prismriver]]. It's a pun on "[[Nurupo (meme)|]]" [ぬるぽ], another 2ch computer-programming meme short for Null Point Excpetion (Used in the same way as "Disregard that, I suck dicks" would.).
It comes from the fact that due to a bug in [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]], Merlin would act improperly during the Prismriver's final spell card. This cause fans to portray her as crazy or rebellious.
For the purposes of the tag, it has to do with Merupo's Shift-JIS: ξ・∀・） in the picture, sometimes replacing her face.

title: groundhog_day
body: Groundhog Day is a 1993 American fantasy romantic comedy film directed by [[Harold Ramis]] from a screenplay by him and Danny Rubin. Starring [[Bill Murray]], Andie MacDowell, and Chris Elliott, it tells the story of a cynical television weatherman covering the annual [[Groundhog Day]] event in Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania, who becomes trapped in a time loop, forcing him to relive February 2 repeatedly.

title: harold_ramis
body: Harold Allen Ramis (/ˈreɪmɪs/; November 21, 1944 – February 24, 2014) was an actor, comedian, and filmmaker. His film acting roles include [[Egon Spengler]] in [[Ghostbusters]] (1984) and Ghostbusters II (1989), and as Russell Ziskey in Stripes (1981); he also co-wrote those films. As a director, his films include the comedies Caddyshack (1980), National Lampoon's Vacation (1983), [[Groundhog Day]] (1993), Analyze This (1999) and Analyze That (2002).

body:
An image depiction including noticeable themes of a Chinese wedding.

h4. Examples

Often red and gold in color. It can be distinguished by its complex embroidery, depicting designs of such things like dragons, phoenixes and flowers.

title: han_juri
body:
[b]Han Juri[/b] ([i]katakana[/i]: [b]ハン・ジュリ[/b], [i]hangul[/i]: [b]한주리[/b]) is a character in the [[Street Fighter]] series. She makes her debut in [[street_fighter_iv_(series)|Super Street Fighter IV]]. She is the first [[Korea|Korean]] character in the Street Fighter series, and the only one that uses [[Taekwondo]] so far. She is voiced by [[Kitamura Eri]] in Japanese and Jessica Strauss in English.

She is described as being an "evil, mean and nasty" member of S.I.N. who is a main character in the SFIV storyline. The character was created by request of many Korean fans who wished for [[Capcom]] to add a Korean character in Street Fighter, something already established by [[SNK]] and [[Namco]]. 

She is depicted as being overtly [[sadism|sadistic]] and often makes denigrating and [[sexually suggestive]] remarks toward her opponents. [spoiler]According to [[Menat]], this cruel demeanor is simply a facade to hide her emotional pain and suffering as a result of her traumatic experience after her parents were killed by [[m. bison|M. Bison]], who blinded her left eye, along with her mistreatment after she was captured as a test subject by Shadaloo and S.I.N.[/spoiler]

Juri's left eye was replaced with a "Feng Shui engine," a device capable of enhancing one's power with ki energy, in which she typically covered it with her [[eyepatch]] or [[diagonal bangs]]. Normally, she has [[purple eyes]], but she may appear as a [[heterochromia|heterochromic]] when she uses the Feng Shui engine in her left eye, causing it to become [[blue eyes|blue]].

Ironically, Juri is initially met with negative reception from some Korean fanbases, primarily due to her "non-authentic" appearance, albeit these negative connotations would be dissipated afterwards. Her creation is also seen as a rib to [[The King of Fighters]] as all the Korean characters in that franchise, particularly [[Kim Kaphwan]], are either representatives of Justice or evildoers who redeem themselves, while she is (at least initially) a servant of evil. 

h4. Known moves

* Fuhajin
** Fuharenjin

* Shikusen
** [[Street Fighter III (series)|2nd Impact]]
*** [[street_fighter_iii_(series)|3rd Strike]]

* Senpusha
** Kaisen Dankairaku

* Kasatsushi

* Feng Shui Engine
other_names: ジュリ(ストリートファイター)

title: dianzi
body: Traditional Chinese hat of the [[Manchu clothes|Manchurian people]]. It's semicircular in shape, reminiscent of a [[kepi]] or [[cabbie hat]], with its visor. However, some versions do not have a visor. Its literal translation is hat ring. It's often a made up of a metal frame, adorned with materials like silk or rattan. Common patterns on the dianzi includes dragons, phoenixes, butterflies, bats, flowers and clouds. It was often worn over [[liangbatou]], to protect the hairstyle. It is hat, so tiara shaped hair ornaments/hairbands may be better described as [[dalachi_(headdress)|]] or [[fengguan]]. h4. Examples * !post #7796708 * !post #7220180: Dianzi with [[lappet]]s (hat flaps). h4. See also * [[Dalachi_(headdress)|]] * [[Fengguan]] * [[Kokoshnik]] * [[Zhuang hat]] h4. External links * "Westca forums (Photo examples of the dianzi)":[https://www.westca.com/pda/forums/op=view_next/t=1182713/lang=schinese.html#0]

title: nijigasaki_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by students of Nijigasaki High School (虹ヶ咲学園) in [[Love Live! School idol festival]] and [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. It comes in 2 main variants; a winter version and a summer version. Additionally, most characters add personal touches to their uniform, like omitting or replacing certain pieces, adding extra layers, etc. Specific changes to the uniform are listed on the respective character's page.

The [[winter uniform]] consists of the following:
* [[black jacket|black]] [[jacket]] with golden [[buttons]]
* [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]]
* [[grey skirt|grey]] or [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[miniskirt]]

The [[summer uniform]] consists of:
* [[black vest|black]] [[vest]] or [[yellow sweater vest|yellow]] [[sweater vest]]
* [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] or [[blue shirt|light blue]] [[collared shirt]]
* [[blue skirt|navy blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[miniskirt]]

Both versions feature a [[neck ribbon]] which is a different color depending on the grade ([[yellow ribbon|yellow]] for first years, [[red ribbon|red]] second years , and [[green ribbon|green]] for third years)

h4. Examples
* !post #5649100: Winter uniform
* !post #6294183: Summer uniform

h4. See also
* [[Otonokizaka school uniform]]
* [[Uranohoshi school uniform]]
* [[Yuigaoka school uniform]]
* [[Hasu no Sora school uniform]]
* [[List of uniforms]]

h4. External links
* "Nijigasaki High School on Love Live! Wiki":[http://love-live.wikia.com/wiki/Nijigasaki_High_School]

title: yuigaoka_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by the students attending the regular course at Yuigaoka Girls' High School in [[Love Live! Superstar!!]]

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]] with a [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]] and a [[short dress|short]] [[grey dress|grey]] [[pinafore dress]]. The [[winter uniform]] has an [[open jacket|open]] [[blue jacket|blue]] [[jacket]] and the shirt is [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]], while in the [[summer uniform]] there is no jacket and the shirt is [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]].

There is also a separate version for the students [[yuigaoka_music_program_school_uniform|who are part of the music program]].

title: adeptus_astartes
body:
The [b]Adeptus Astartes[/b] (Space Marines) are a tabletop army in [[Warhammer 40K]]. They are a faction within the Imperium of Man, and consist of genetically modified warrior monks. The Adeptus Astartes is split into many chapters of a thousand marines. Each chapter has their own distinct appearance, and some differ quite a bit in terms of traits and tactics. Space Marines are known for wearing massive [[power armor]], painted in their chapter's colors, and wielding [[bolter]]s.

h4. Chapters
* [[Dark Angels]] - I - led by [[Lion El'Jonson]] - Loyalist
* [I]DELETED[/I] - II - led by [b][REDACTED][/B] - ???
* [[Emperor's Children]] - III - led by [[Fulgrim]] - Traitor
* [[Iron Warriors]] - IV - led by [[Perturabo]] - Traitor
* [[White Scars]] - V - led by [[Jaghatai Khan]] - Loyalist 
* [[Space Wolves]] - VI - led by [[Leman Russ]] - Loyalist
* [[Imperial Fists]] - VII - led by [[Rogal Dorn]] - Loyalist
* [[Night Lords]] - VIII - led by [[Konrad Curze]] - Traitor
* [[Blood Angels]] - IX  - led by [[Sanguinius]] - Loyalist
* [[Iron Hands (Warhammer)|]] - X - led by [[Ferrus Manus]] - Loyalist
* [I]DELETED[/I] - XI - led by [b][REDACTED][/B] - ???
* [[World Eaters]] - XII - led by [[Angron]] - Traitor
* [[Ultramarines]] - XIII - led by [[Roboute Guilliman]] - Loyalist
* [[Death Guard]] - XIV- led by [[Mortarion]] - Traitor
* [[Thousand Sons]] - XV - led by [[Magnus the Red]] - Traitor
* [[Black Legion|Luna Wolves/Sons of Horus/Black Legion]] - XVI - led by [[Horus Lupercal]] - Traitor
* [[Word Bearers]] - XVII - led by [[Lorgar Aurelian]] - Traitor 
* [[Salamanders (Warhammer)|]] - XVIII - led by [[Vulkan]] - Loyalist
* [[Raven Guard]] - XIX - led by [[Corvus Corax (warhammer)|]] - Loyalist

title: merino_(monster_musume)
body:
Merino is a female monster of the faun Pan subspecies.
She has matching [[light blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]], her canon height is 158 cm (or 5'2"), she weight 48kg (or 106lbs) and her canon measurements are bust:88(F)/waist:59/hip:85.

She is frequently seen with her friend [[Cathyl]].
She used to work as a farm hand at a ranch near the Onsen Town, but later transferred to the Black Lily Ranch to share her expertise. 

She first appeared in the chapter 33 of [[monster musume no iru nichijou]]

title: eclair_(girls_und_panzer)
body:
A character from [[Girls und Panzer]]. She is the overall captain of Maginot girls' academy's senshado team and commander of a Somua S35.

She was initially a spinoff original character, who was introduced in [[Girls und panzer gekitou! maginot-sen desu!!]], created by [[Saitaniya Ryouichi]].

She also appears in the spinoff, [[Girls und Panzer Ribbon no Musha]]. 

She later appears in the second film of [[Girls und Panzer Saishuushou|Girls und Panzer Das Finale]] and became the first character of spinoff origin to be brought to the anime. She is voiced by [[Touyama Nao|]].

Her real name revealed by Saitaniya Ryouichi is Ekure Reika(江呉 麗佳)."Source":https://x.com/xxsaitaniyaxx/status/1674390116465524736

title: linkin_park
body:
An American alternative rock band from [[California]].

The band is currently composed of [[Michael Kenji Shinoda|Mike Shinoda]] (vocals, keyboard, piano), Emily Armstrong (vocals), [[Bradford Phillip Delson|Brad Delson]] (guitar), Colin Brittain (drums), [[David Michael Farrell|Dave Farrell]] (bass), and [[Joseph Hahn|Joe Hahn]] (DJ, sampler, programing).

[[Chester Charles Bennington|Chester Bennington]], one of the band's lead vocalists, passed away on July 20, 2017 after committing suicide. Emily Armstrong would later take on the role of co-lead vocalist after the band's reformation in September of 2024. Drummer [[Rob Bourdon]] left the band prior to their reformation, being replaced by Colin Brittain.

title: sunny_splosion
body:
Sunny Splosion is a female English-speaking [[indie virtual youtuber|independent]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] who reportedly debuted on 30 July 2022.

She has [[short hair|short]], [[streaked hair|streaked]] [[grey hair|grey]] and [[blonde hair|yellow]] hair, topped with 2 [[antenna hair|antennas]]. Her hair is long enough to reach [[hair between eyes|between]] her [[purple eyes|purple]]/[[pink eyes|pink]] eyes, forming [[crossed bangs]]. She wears a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]], [[grey shirt|grey]] [[crop top]] with [[cross-laced top|cross-laces]] (revealing her [[navel]] and [[midriff]]) and [[black pants]] held in place with a [[black belt]]. More uniquely, she has [[scar on arm|scars]] on the shoulders that magically reveal [[space print|outer space]].

title: the_hunger_games
body:
A trilogy of sci-fi novels by Suzanne Collins. The series is set in the dystopian future country Panem (located in North America and encompassing the territories of the real-life countries Canada, the USA and Mexico), where 12 districts must send 2 tributes (one male and one female) to the titular Hunger Games, a yearly battle royale to the death.

The books were adapted into live action films released from 2012 to 2015.

title: todd_ingram
body:
[[Scott Pilgrim (series)|]] character. [[ramona flowers|Ramona]]'s third evil ex, and current boyfriend of [[Envy Adams]]. Bassist of The Clash at Demonhead. He's also a vegan, which apparently gives him superpowers.

In the [[Scott Pilgrim Takes Off|anime]], he plays [[scott pilgrim|Scott]] in [[neil nordegraf|Young Neil]]'s movie. He ends up having an on-set fling with [[Wallace Wells]] while dressed as Scott. He immediately becomes infatuated with Wallace, though the feelings are not mutual.

[b]CV:[/b] Brandon Routh (EN), [[Hatano Wataru]] (JPN)

h4. External links

* "Scott Pilgrim Wiki: Todd Ingram":https://scottpilgrim.fandom.com/wiki/Todd_Ingram

title: wallace_wells
body: [[Scott Pilgrim (series)|]] character. Introduced as [[scott pilgrim|Scott]]'s "cool gay roommate" that he mooches off and serves as the snarky voice of reason. Hooks up with various male characters, though also appears to have had feelings for Scott at some point. Often gossips with (and steals the boyfriends of) Scott's sister [[stacey pilgrim|Stacey]]. Almost always has a [[jitome]] expression or [[smug]] look on his face, and commonly seen with a [[martini]] in hand. In the [[scott pilgrim takes off|anime]], he plays himself in [[neil nordegraf|Young Neil]]'s movie after heckling the old actor (who he describes as a "notorious heterosexual", a meta gag to Kieran Culkin) too much, and ends up having an on-set fling with [[Todd Ingram]], with the running gag being that Todd is dressed as Scott, who he's playing in the movie. Sometimes drawn as a [[cat boy]] due to official sketches. CV: [[Kieran Culkin]] (EN), Fukunishi Masaya (JPN) h4. External links * "Scott Pilgrim Wiki: Wallace Wells":https://scottpilgrim.fandom.com/wiki/Wallace_Wells

title: tsuchinoko
body:
The Tsuchinoko meaning "hammerspawn", is a legendary [[snake]]-like cryptid from Japan. The name [i]tsuchinoko[/i] is prevalent in Western Japan, including Kansai and Shikoku; the creature is known as [i]bachi hebi[/i] in Northeastern Japan.

Tsuchinoko are described as being between 30 and 80 centimeters in length, similar in appearance to a snake, but with a central girth that is much wider than its head or [[snake tail|tail]], and as having [[fangs]] and venom similar to that of a viper.

[[Kirisame Marisa]] adopts the tsuchinoko found in [i][[Eastern and Little Nature Deity]][/i] as a pet.

For the [[Youkai Watch]] character, see [[Tsuchinoko (Youkai Watch)]]. For the [[Kemono Friends]] character, see [[Tsuchinoko (Kemono Friends)]]. For the [[Bocchi the Rock!]] character, see [[Gotoh Hitori (Tsuchinoko)]].

title: scott_pilgrim
body:
Protagonist of the [[Scott Pilgrim (series)|]] series. A nerdy guy in his early 20s who is generally cheerful and friendly towards other characters. Lives with his gay college friend [[wallace wells|Wallace]] and mostly mooches off him, though Wallace doesn't seem to mind. Plays in a band called Sex Bomb-omb.

He keeps seeing a mysterious girl in his dreams, and it later turns out that she's real, and her name is [[Ramona Flowers]]. In order to win Ramona's love, Scott must defeat her seven "evil exes".

He has short [[orange hair]] and wears a [[yellow shirt]] and a pair of [[jeans]].

[b]CV:[/b] [[Michael Cera]] (EN), [[Shimono Hiro]] (JPN)

* [[Nega Scott]]
* [[Scott Pilgrim (prototype)]]

title: scott_pilgrim_(series)
body:
[b]Scott Pilgrim[/b] is a series of graphic stories by Bryan Lee O'Malley. 

The series is about [[Scott Pilgrim]], a slacker and part-time young musician (and occasional "hip street fighter") who lives in Toronto and plays bass guitar in the band [i]Sex [[Bob-Omb]][/i]. 

The comic has several classic video game references in its plot. The author has cited that the game [[Downtown Nekketsu Monogatari]] (known outside Japan as [i]River City Ransom[/i]) had a huge influence on it.

A film adaptation of the series titled [[Scott Pilgrim vs the World (movie)|]] and starring actor Michael Cera in the title role was released in August 2010.  A video game of the same name developed by Ubisoft for PlayStation Network and Xbox Live Arcade was released the same month. An anime adaptation by [[Science SARU]] would release over a decade later in 2023 on [[Netflix]]. The animation, titled [[Scott Pilgrim Takes Off]], is notable for featuring the original movie cast reprising their roles.

body:

h4. Characters

* [[Shinba Kousuke]] （心羽幸助） - Main character.
* [[Aoi Sakura (Tsuma Shibori)|]] （葵咲良）- Older sister, married.
* [[Kotosuki Madoka]] （琴月まどか）- Younger sister.

h6. Sub-Heroines

* [[Takeuchi Himeka]] （竹内姫香）- Owner of the cafe.
* [[Izawa Ritsuko]] （伊澤律子）- Teacher.
* [[Tsubaki Yukie]] （椿雪絵）- Owner of sake bar, wife of Yoshiharu, mother of Kyouya.
* [[Miyamae Rumina]] （宮前るみな）- Genius kid.

h6. Competition

* [[Tsubaki Yoshiharu]] （椿良治）- Salary man, husband of Yukie, father of Kyouya.
* [[Tsubaki Kyouya]] （椿京弥）- Boy, son of Yoshiharu and Yukie.
* [[Yokosuka Saburou]] （横須賀三郎）- Middle age chubby man, owner of grocery store.

h6. Support characters

* [[Yasuzumi Daichi]] （安住大地）- Guy with messy hair, unshaved chin, and red shirt. Roommate of Kousuke up until Dec 16.
* [[Oohashi Keita]] （大橋圭太）- Good friend of Kousuke, blond guy with glasses, blue shirt.
* [[Akiyama Naotsugu]] （秋山直嗣）- PE Teacher, fiance of Ritsuko.

title: imminent_spanking
body:
When a character is about to be [[spanked]], but the [[spanking]] hasn't happened yet. Typically seen when the character is in position to be spanked and the person spanking them is prepared as well with a raised hand or implement in hand. There may also be [[motion lines]] present to indicate the spanking is starting.

The [[ass]] should not have [[slap mark]]s or be red, this indicates that the spanking has yet to occur. If the [[ass]] is already red, then the [[spanked]] tag is more appropriate. 

For individual characters in the same illustration, spanked and imminent spanking are mutually exclusive unless its a [[comic]] or [[multiple views]].

h4. Examples

h5. Imminent Spanking

* !post #7197078
* !post #8064838
* !post #7834252
* !post #7672161

h5. Spanked

* !post #8026495
* !post #8064842
* !post #7567631
* !post #8058521

h5. Comparison between spanked (left) and imminent spanking (right)

* !post #7672154

title: medusa_(kid_icarus)
body:
A major character in the [[Kid Icarus]] series. She is the Goddess of Darkness, and formerly ruled Angel Land with [[Palutena]]. 

After she attacked humanity, she was cursed by Palutena to have a monstrous appearance, with [[snake hair]] and [[colored skin]]. She swore to get revenge on Palutena ever since.

In the original Kid Icarus, Medusa has [[green skin]], [[curly hair]], and a [[cyclops|single eye]]. She wears a [[pink dress]] and has [[claws|clawed hands]] and [[clawed feet|feet]].

As of [[Kid Icarus Uprising]], she has a semi-humanoid appearance, with a [[facial tattoo]] and [[white skin]], and the skin on her arms fades into [[black scales]] and ends with monstrous [[claws]]. She wears a long [[purple dress]] that exposes a small bit of [[cleavage]] and has a [[sideboob]], and only has [[single_sleeve|one sleeve]]. Her dress fades into a deep red. She is adorned with various [[jewelry]], including a [[single earring]], and a snakelike [[gold armlet]]. 

After she is weakened by [[Pit_(kid_icarus)|Pit]] in Uprising, she exposes her true form, which has a similar single [[red eyes|red eye]] and [[fangs]] as her original design.

title: collin_(kid_icarus)
body:
The Collin is a monster from the [[Kid Icarus]] Series. 

In the original Kid Icarus, the Collin resembles a [[Centurion]] with bulky [[gold armor]] and [[white wings]] on its back.

In [[Kid Icarus Uprising]], it retains its former appearance with some minor differences—it no longer has wings, and it possesses additional [[armor]], a red [[cape]], and two cannons from which it launches [[phil_(kid_icarus)|Phils]].

title: hidaka_noriko
body:

She was born on May 31, 1962.

title: raymond_(animal_crossing)
body:
A smug [[cat boy]] that appears in [[Animal Crossing]]. 

He wears [[glasses]] and has [[heterochromia]], and has a little blonde hair flip on his forehead. His fashion sense and the way he decorates his house implies that he idealizes the aesthetic of the white-collar middle-manager office worker. 

Following the release of New Horizons, he gained shocking popularity online. This led to him being sold and traded like a digital commodity among players.

title: dom_(animal_crossing)
body:
A Jock sheep villager introduced in [[Animal Crossing]]: New Horizons.

Dom is a pink-skinned sheep with white wool and hot pink horns. He has large, sparkling eyes. His hooves are white. His initial shirt is the Tie-dye tee. In Pocket Camp, he wears the rainbow tee styled as a scarf (like sheep in games prior to New Horizons). Dom has a jock personality and has a great interest in sports and bodybuilding.

title: lee-enfield
body:
The Lee-Enfield is a series of [[bolt action]] [[rifle]]s that came in several models, chambered for .303 British [[rifle cartridge|cartridge]]. The [[weapon]] was named after its designer, James Paris [b]Lee[/b]—and the rifling design location—the Royal Small Arms Factory in [b]Enfield[/b]. It was the standard rifle of [[united kingdom|British]] and Commonwealth [[military|forces]] during [[World War I]] and [[World War II]]. 

The feed system is detachable 10-[[ammunition|round]] [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]], usually fed from 5-round [[clip (weapon)|clips]].

* !post #6225815: Full-length Lee-Enfield (top) and the No. 5 Mk I "Jungle Carbine" variant with shortened stock (center).

h4. See also
* [[Lee-Enfield (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Lee-Enfield":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lee–Enfield

title: the_war_of_genesis
body:
A series of Korean RPGs from the late 90s and early 2000s. While the first and second games were cult classics, the third game went on to catapult the series into widespread success in South Korea. Despite the series' popularity, it has never been officially translated to Japanese or English.

title: m45_meusoc
body:
The MEU(SOC) [[handgun|pistol]], ("[b]M[/b]arine [b]e[/b]xpeditionary [b]u[/b]nit ([b]s[/b]pecial [b]o[/b]perations [b]c[/b]apable)") officially designated the M45 MEUSOC is an [[M1911]] variant. It became the sidearm for the Force Recon Element of the [[United States Marine Corps|USMC's]] Marine Expeditionary Units since 1985. The [[gun|handgun]] features some modernized features like longer pointy back spur, skeletonized external hammer, dovetail rear sights, a wraparound Pachmayr grip and a lighter trigger with hole(s). 

This also applies to its most recent variant, the M45A1 CQBP which was introduced in 2012. Visually identifiable by its railed dust cover, diagonal front slide serrations and desert tan coloring.

* !post #6334159: Comparison of the M45 MEUSOC (bottom) and the M1911 (top).

h4. See also
* [[H&K Mark 23]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links
* "Special-ops.org":https://special-ops.org/meu-soc-pistol/
* "Wikipedia: MEU(SOC) pistol":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MEU(SOC)_pistol

title: vivian_(paper_mario)
body:
A Shadow Siren from [[Paper Mario: The Thousand Year Door]]. First confirmed transgender character in the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]] - the English localization of the original game changed this, but it was restored in the remake. 

She is a ghost with [[purple skin]] and [[ghost tail|a tail instead of legs]], long curly [[pink hair]], and a striped [[witch hat]].

Vivian is very shy and self-conscious. Her sisters, particularly [[Beldam]], constantly belittle her by calling her male terms despite her protests, though she is too shy to stand up for herself. She defects from her sisters to join [[Mario]]'s party and [spoilers]ultimately help him defeat her supposed master, the [[Shadow Queen]][/spoilers], learning to respect herself more along the way.

h4. External links

* "Mario Wiki: Vivian":https://www.mariowiki.com/Vivian
other_names: ビビアン(ペーパーマリオRPG)

title: battleship_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft|spaceships]] from the [[EVE Online]].
Large, durable but slow vessels designed for heavy duty engagement.

Battleships (BSs, rarely BBs from US Navy terminology) are the biggest, heaviest sub-capital [[combat ship (EVE Online)|]]s in EVE Online. They are correspondingly expensive, with even the cheapest battleship hulls selling for hundreds of millions of ISK. Tech 1 battleships are standard tools in higher-level PvE combat, are used in some large [[fleet]] doctrines in PvP combat, and are sometimes also used for solo or small gang PvP.
There are two classes of [[Tech 2 ship (EVE Online)|Tech 2]] battleships: [[Marauder (EVE Online)|]]s, which are specialized for mission-running, and Black Ops battleships, which can either transport fleets of stealthy ships across long distances using covert cynosural fields or open the door for friendly [[capital ship (EVE Online)|]]s to join a fight.
All battleships also come equipped with a [[Frigate (EVE Online)|]] Escape Bay, enabling battleship pilots to stay in a fight after their battleship explodes.
All battleships (except Praxis) have a role bonus known as the "battleship role bonus": 100% bonus to Shield Extender hitpoints, 50% bonus to Armor Plate hitpoints, 5% Additional bonus to Reinforced Bulkhead hitpoints.
Battleships use large weapons that are poor against small targets like frigates. All battleships (except Marshal) have a drone bay, allowing them to use [[combat drone (EVE Online)|drones]] to engage and kill enemies that they cannot hit with ship weapons.

h4. External links
* "EVE Universe: Battleships":https://universe.eveonline.com/lore/battleships
* "EVE University Wiki: Battleships":https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Battleships

title: aragami_oga_(2nd_costume)

* !post #5237950: Profile

title: aragami_oga_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[Holostars]]' [[Aragami Oga]].

It consists of a [[black shirt|black]] [[open shirt]] with [[sleeves rolled up]] and green [[high collar]], [[black pants]], left [[chest guard]] that has green [[tiger print]], a jeweled [[collar]] attached to patterned [[necktie]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]] with bright green sole and collar. On his hips he wears a [[holster]] that holds three brown [[pouch|pouches]] (in which he keeps a [[Game Boy Advance]], [[neo geo pocket color|Neo Geo Pocket]], and plenty of retro games, according to him), and he has a [[thigh pouch]]. He also wears [[partially fingerless gloves]], a round silver [[single earring]], and a black [[eyepatch]] - which can be removed at will.

title: jamaican_daningan
body:
A fictional antagonist character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] anime series from 1985.

[b]Jamaican Daninghan[/b] is the quintessential [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] officer, arrogant and heavily abusive towards his own men, and openly looked down upon every last one of them. A heavy smoking, thin and tall [[brown hair]]ed man with [[short hair]] and a massive moustache, Jamaican was one of [[Bask Om]]'s top henchmen, and often took point as the Titans primary field commander. He was heavily disliked by [[Yazan Gable]].

[spoiler]During a battle near an old [[Gwazine]] ship [[wreckage]] [[Yazan Gable]] lured [[AEUG]] pilot [[Emma Sheen]] into firing her [[Super Gundam]]'s long [[beam rifle]] at the bridge of Jamaican's battleship, killing Jamaican for him.[/spoiler]
other_names: ジャマイカン・ダニンガン

title: harapeko_yousai_wa_isekai_de_dai_senkan_ga_tsukuritai:_world_of_sandbox
body:
[i]Harapeko Yousai wa Isekai de Dai Senkan ga Tsukuritai: World of Sandbox[/i] (lit. [i]The Hungry Fortress Wants to Build a Battleship in Another World: World of Sandbox[/i]) is a sci-fi fantasy isekai light novel series by Tentenko and illustrated by [[Haga Yui]].

The series follows Eve, a male Japanese gamer hooked on a MMO space civilization builder, who awakes find that they're now inside their command fortress from the game and that they've become their female avatar.  Finding herself accompanied by her AI assistant from the game, Ringo, they learn they've been stranded in the middle of the ocean with limited resources and so begin rebuilding so they can secure resources to one day again reach for the stars.  Unfortunately things aren't going to be easy when they learn that the creatures and beings of this this world can possess powers that completely defy scientific theory. Thus begins the battle between sci-fi and fantasy.

h4. Characters

* [[Eve_(harapeko_yousai)|]]

title: lgbt_pride
body:
An image whose main focus or theme is LGBT pride.

Common examples include characters holding LGBT flags, wearing LGBT-themed makeup or clothing, displaying [[rainbow]]-themed imagery, or commemorating [[Pride Month]], a holiday observed in June in various countries.

LGBT is an abbreviation for lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender. These terms are used to describe a person's sexual orientation or gender identity. Other common terms include LGBTQ or LGBTQ+, with Q meaning "queer" or "questioning" and the + added in recognition of all non-straight, non-cisgender identities.

title: 9m111_fagot
body:
The 9M111 Fagot (Russian: Фагот; "bassoon"; NATO reporting name AT-4 Spigot) is a second-generation tube-launched semi-automatic command to line of sight (SACLOS) wire-guided [[anti-tank missile]] of the [[Soviet Union]] for use from ground or vehicle mounts. The 9K111 Fagot missile system  was developed by the Tula KBP Design Bureau for Instrument Building. 

The missile is stored and carried in a container/launch tube. It is fired from a 9P135 launcher post, a simple [[tripod]]. A 9S451 guidance box is fitted to the tripod with the missile sitting just above. The 9Sh119 sight is fitted to the left side (from the gunner's point of view). The complete launcher system weighs 22.5 kg (50 lb). The gunner lies prone while firing. 

North Korea was said to have acquired a number of the systems during the late 1980s until the 2000s. These were subsequently reverse-engineered under the designation Bulsae-2. It was advertised under designation AT-4MLB by North Korean proxy company GLOCOM, in brochure it was stated that it is controlled by laser beam guidance method, which was an upgrade designated Bulsae-3. Its use was first reported in 2014 in the ranks of the Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades and the Al-Nasser Salah al-Deen Brigades.

title: anti-tank_missile
body:
An anti-tank guided missile (ATGM), anti-tank missile, anti-tank guided weapon (ATGW) or anti-armor guided weapon is a guided [[missile]] primarily designed to hit and destroy heavily armored military vehicles (e.g. [[tank]]s, [[armored personnel carrier]]s, etc). ATGMs range in size from shoulder-launched weapons, which can be transported by a single soldier, to larger [[tripod]]-mounted weapons, which require a squad or team to transport and fire, to vehicle and aircraft mounted missile systems. 

h4. List of ATGMs

h5. Crew-serviced/Vehicle mounted ATGMs 

* [[BGM-71 TOW]]
* [[9M133 Kornet]]
* [[9M113 Konkurs]]
* [[9M111 Fagot]]

h5. Shoulder-launched ATGMs
* [[M47 Dragon]]
* [[FGM-148 Javelin]]

title: akumatsu
body:
A character that originally appeared in [i][[Osomatsu-san]][/i].

He is the [[personification]] of the Matsuno brothers' latent evil. Because of the large quantity of said evil, his physical form is a large amorphous demon-like creature. He is the antithesis of [[Kamimatsu]].

He is usually depicted in fanart in a more humanoid form, resembling a Matsuno with [[red eyes]]/[[red sclera|sclera]] and [[sharp teeth]].

title: 9m113_konkurs
body: The 9M113 Konkurs (Russian: Конкурс; NATO reporting name AT-5 Spandrel) is a [[Soviet Army|Soviet]] semi-automatic command to line of sight (SACLOS) wire-guided [[anti-tank missile]]. A development of the [[9K111 Fagot]] with greater firepower, the 9M113 Konkurs can use the same launchers and is very similar visually, distinguishable only by a slight bulge towards the end of the Konkurs' missile tube. It can be serviced by a single individual when used by infantry is [[tripod]]-mounted.

title: bgm-71_tow
body: The BGM-71 TOW ("Tube-launched, Optically tracked, Wire-guided", pronounced /ˈtoʊ/) is an [[United States Army|American]] crew-served, wire-guided [[anti-tank missile]]. First produced in 1970, TOW is one of the most widely used anti-tank guided missiles. It can be found in a wide variety of manually carried and vehicle-mounted forms, as well as widespread use on helicopters. Originally designed by Hughes Aircraft in the 1960s, the weapon is currently produced by RTX.

title: genderswap
body:
A "genderswap" refers to the almost magical version of a sex change, wherein a character of one sex turns into one of the other sex without any medical involvement. 

This tag can also apply to an image of a character of one sex depicted as one of the opposite sex (e.g. a male version of a female character or vice versa). May also apply to male-to-[[futanari]], but since futanari is not wholly female, female-to-futanari may also qualify. A being with no sex depicted as any of these may technically count.

This tag can also be applied to an [[otoko no ko]] if the character is given female traits such as the presence of actual [[cleavage]] or the obvious absence of a [[bulge]] at the crotch. For [[reverse trap]]s, the absence of cleavage or presence of a bulge applies.

If a character is genderswapped often enough, the genderswapped version may be given its own name. For male-to-female genderswaps, this is often the normal character's name with "ko" appended to it. (子 "Ko" meaning "child" is a common ending for Japanese girls' names.) For female-to-male genderswaps, "o" is sometimes added. 

Known in Internet circles as Rule 63, wherein there is a female or male version of any given male or female character, respectively.

[b]Notes:[/b] 
* If the person has only swapped bodies with another from the opposite sex, but the body itself has not changed, then use [[personality switch]] instead.
* The "女体化" tag may also on occasion be used to describe female [[personification]], rather than a genderswap.
* If a character in canon is genderswapped but rarely shown in their original form (such as [[Mai Natsume]] or [[Tanya Degurechaff]]), the tag only applies if said original form is included or somehow alluded to.
h4. See also

* [[Genderswap (FTM)]]
* [[Genderswap (MTF)]]
* [[Genderswap (OTF)]]
* [[Genderswap (OTM)]]
* [[Midnight Bliss]]
* [[List of Genderswap Characters]]
* [[Tag group:Artistic license]]

title: atlanta_hawks
body:
A Professional [[basketball]] team based in Atlanta, [[Georgia_(STate)|]]. Founded in 1946 as the Buffalo Bison, they've played in Milwaukee, and St. Louis before settling in Atlanta. The Hawks have played in 4 NBA Finals, winning one in 1958. Despite a long Championship drought, they have one of the most playoff appearances in the association.

Notable current and former players include [[Trae Young]], Zaccharie Risacher, [[Dejounte Murray]] Vince Carter, Jeff Teague, Bob Pettit, and Dominique Wilkins

Their uniforms include the main colors of Red, Black and Yellow, with gray accents. The main home uniforms are Black with yellow Lettering and Red Trimming. Their away uniforms are White with Red Lettering and Red and white trimming. Their alternate uniforms are Red with white Lettering and Red Trimming. The Logo is line silhouette of a Hawk. The Logo is known as the Pac logo, looking like silhouette of [[Pac-man]] 

h4. Team Website 

Team website: <https://www.nba.com/hawks/>
* "Wikipedia: Atlanta Hawks":[https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlanta_Hawks]

h1. See Also 
[[National Basketball Association]]
[[Basketball]]
[[georgia_(state)]]

title: celeste_(animal_crossing)
body:
A red anthropomorphic [[owl]] from [[Animal Crossing]].

Celeste is [[Blathers (animal crossing)|]]' younger sister. Her character design is similar to his, except with the predominantly red color scheme, and a big pink bow on the back of her head. 

She's had different roles in various games of the series; working in an observatory, managing a gift shop, or appearing to inform the player about nightly meteor showers. In most games, her role is themed on outer space, stars and other celestial objects. (Hence her name.)

This makes Blathers and Celeste the "owl scientist siblings" of Animal Crossing: The older brother skilled in biology, and the younger sister skilled in astrophysics. 

h4. External links

* "Nookipedia: Celeste":https://nookipedia.com/wiki/Celeste

title: blathers_(animal_crossing)
body:
A brown anthropomorphic [[owl]] from [[Animal Crossing]].

He has appeared in most games of the series as the manager and curator of the village museum. His character design seems to take inspiration from a British college professor, from his green bowtie, to the pattern of his feathers, to some of the Britishisms he speaks with. 

While he's polite and friendly to a fault, it's a running gag of the series that he hates bugs. He'll accept bug donations for the museum, and he'll even educate the player on bug facts. But he does these things under dramatic duress. 

Has a red-colored sister named [[Celeste (animal crossing)|]].

A blue [[dodo (bird)|]] from the [[Animal Crossing]] franchise. Works at the airport as the pilot, flying the player to other people's islands or to mystery islands.
He wears a [[pilot uniform]] consisting of a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]], a [[red necktie|red]] [[necktie]], and a [[black belt|black]] [[belt]] with a small [[belt pouch|pouch]]. She has [[brown hair|brown]] bangs, like her mother, and wears a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[blue dress|blue]] [[dress]]. Since [i]New Leaf[/i], she appears slightly older and now also has a [[yellow headwear|yellow]] [[hat]] resembling a [[school hat]].

She has [[brown hair|brown]] bangs and wears [[red lips|red]] [[lipstick]], a [[green apron|green]] [[apron]] with a [[fish print|fish]] on it, and carries a [[spatula]].

title: japanese_white-eye
body:
A species of [[bird]].

The head and back of this small perching [[bird]] are olive-green, the throat may be bright yellow, and the belly is pale green or grey. It has a prominent pale white ring around each eye, for which it is named in both English and Japanese.

One of the native species of the Japanese islands, this bird has been depicted in Japanese art on numerous occasions, and historically was kept as a cage bird.

In 2018, molecular DNA evidence convinced scientists to combine this species with that of the warbling white-eye, by which name the Japanese white-eye is now officially known.

* !post #5283483

title: bleeding_heart_(flower)
body:
A common name for several genera of [[flower]]ing plants in the [[poppy (flower)|]] family ([i]Papaveraceae[/i]), native to East Asia.

The bleeding heart plants produce arching flower-bearing stems with hanging flowers. The flowers have a distinctive shape, resembling a conventional [[heart]], with narrow droplet-like petals beneath, hence the common name. Common flower colors are pink, purple-pink, red, and white. The leaves are lobed.

h4. Examples

* !asset #23440347: Photo reference: [i]Dicentra peregrina[/i]
* !asset #23440360: Photo reference: [i]Lamprocapnos spectabilis[/i]
* !post #2629328: [i]Lamprocapnos spectabilis[/i]
* !post #6322348: [i]Lamprocapnos spectabilis[/i]

h4. See also

title: sonic_x
body:
[b]Sonic X[/b] (ソニックX, [i]Sonikku Ekkusu[/i]) is an anime based on the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] video game series. Produced by TMS Entertainment under partnership with [[Sega]] and [[Sonic Team]], and directed by Hajime Kamegaki, Sonic X was first broadcasted in Japan in April 2003 by [[TV Tokyo]].

The story initially follows [[Sonic the Hedgehog]] and most of the main cast being suddenly transported to Earth during a Chaos Control incident at [[Dr. Eggman]]'s base. On Earth, Sonic finds hospitality with a human boy named [[christopher Thorndyke|Chris Thorndyke]], who provides Sonic and friends with shelter and support against Dr. Eggman's ambitions to conquer the world. Later, the anime also adapt the events of [[Sonic Adventure]], [[Sonic Adventure 2]] and [[Sonic Battle]].

h4. Characters
* [[Bocoe]]
* [[Bokkun (sonic x)|]]
* [[Christopher Thorndyke]]

title: kinu_(retrofit)_(azur_lane)
body:
The kai/retrofit form of [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s [[Kinu (azur lane)|]]. 

Upon retrofit, she trades her white gloves for [[red gloves|red ones]], her black skirt for [[black shorts|shorts]], her kneehighs for [[black thighhighs|thighhighs]], her uniform now has [[military rank insignia|sleeve boards]], [[aiguillette]], and [[epaulettes]], and a [[brown belt]]. Her rigging now has a third 14 cm single mount and an additional pair of torpedo tubes, while her [[sheath]] is now attached to the rigging. 

h4. Appearance

title: mogami_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[Mogami (Kancolle)|]] was the third of her class to be given her second remodel(s) on March 30, 2021.

Her outfit is still basically the same as before except for her color scheme, which has been changed to complement her blazer-wearing sisters: Her shirt is now colored darker brown with a lighter brown sailor collar, the [[neckerchief]] is now colored orange, and she now wears brown [[kneehighs]] and lighter grey boots.

Her [[rigging]] varies between standard CAV form and and transport cruiser form. In the former, she retains her real-life [[flight deck]] and three 20.3 cm twin mounts. In the latter, her flight deck reverts to her pre-1943 refit form with brown wooden planking while she gains a launch ramp for amphibious transport craft.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4481983: CAV kai ni
* !post #4442560: Transport cruiser

title: taihou_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Taihou[/i] in [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]. Character design by [[Shimada Fumikane]], voiced by [[Noto Mamiko]].

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[small breasts]]/[[flat chest]]. Appearance-wise, Taihou is the youngest and smallest of the fleet carrier ship-girls due to her historically short career; she had only been afloat for just over two months before she was sunk by USS [[Albacore (Azur Lane)|]], and only participated in a single battle, the Battle of the Philippine Sea. 

Her outfit consists of a [[white shirt|white]]/[[black shirt]] worn under a [[white shrug]], a collar piece patterned off her real-life bow with a [[kikumon]], [[grey corset]] armor, [[red skirt|red]]/dark [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], black [[bike shorts]], [[black thighhighs]], [[black footwear|black]] [[rudder footwear]], and a metal [[hairband]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life hull and [[flight deck]] to her left (with magazine storage) and her real-life bridge to her right, with 10 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]] mounts on her waist. She uses a [[crossbow]] to launch aircraft. 

h4. Skins

* !post #1690314: Base
* !post #3228245: [[Taihou Kai (kancolle)|Kai]]

h4. See also
* [[Taihou (Azur Lane)]]
* [[Taihou (Warship Girls R)]]

h4. See also
* "Wikipedia: IJN [i]Taihou[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_aircraft_carrier_Taih%C5%8D]

title: gundam_wing_frozen_teardrop
body:
A novel series in the [[Gundam Wing]] continuity, set decades after [[Gundam Wing: Endless Waltz|Endless Waltz]].

The series is somewhat notorious for featuring a cast largely comprised of descendants and clones of the original series' cast, and that almost of it's original [[mobile suit]]s are either not illustrated or only depicted wearing cloaks to obscure their appearance ([[Gundam Prometheus]] being the only exception until the [[Wing Gundam Snow White Prelude]] figure was released).

title: wing_gundam_(ew)
body: A redesign of the original [[Wing Gundam]] by [[Katoki Hajime]], created after the [[Gundam Wing: Endless Waltz]] OVA's release. This take on the suit is designed to more closely resemble the [[Wing Gundam Zero Custom]], and replaces the original design in the TV series' manga adaptation, Glory of Losers.

title: altron_gundam
body:
[b]XXXG-01S2 Altron Gundam[/b]
The upgraded version of the [[Shenlong Gundam]], now equipped with two Dragon Fang gauntlets (one in each forearm) and a beam trident replacing its predecessor's glaive. The [[gundam wing: endless waltz|Endless Waltz]] redesign gives the unit a sleeker look and a green finish, but does not alter its pilot - the ever tumultuous and problematic [[Chang Wufei]].

title: tallgeese_iii
body:
[b]OZ-00MS2B Tallgeese III[/b]
The ultimate development of the [[Tallgeese]] series. A more modernized instance of the original Mobile Suit, it loads a mega cannon and heat rod (resembling the [[Gundam Epyon]]'s own heat rod) as well as the traditional beam saber and head mounted Vulcan guns. It was piloted by "Preventer Wind", a.k.a. [[Zechs Merquise]], during the [[gundam wing: endless waltz|Mariemaia Army's uprising]].

title: super_robot_wars_x
body:
A 2018 release in the [[Super Robot Wars]] series for [[PlayStation Vita]] and [[PlayStation 4]], later ported to [[Nintendo Switch]] and Steam in 2019. The game features a [[fantasy]] setting, which many of the more [[science fiction]] based shows on the roster are transported to. Alongside the roster of licensed series, [[Masaki Andoh]] and his [[Cybuster]] from [[Super Robot Wars Original Generation]] make a playable guest appearance in this game.

title: gundam_deathscythe_hell_custom
body:
[b]XXXG-01D2 Gundam Deathscythe Hell (EW)[/b] 
A redesigned version of the original [[Gundam Deathscythe Hell]], accentuating its demonic characteristics even more while retaining the trademark beam scythe. While its exterior appearance is greatly changed from the TV version, the pilot at its controls is still the same - the easygoing [[Duo Maxwell]].

As with all other redesigns for [[Gundam Wing: Endless Waltz]], the Deathscythe Hell Custom was penned by [[Katoki Hajime]].

title: super_robot_wars_dd
body:
A [[Super Robot Wars]] title released for smartphones in 2019. While all units are unlocked through story progression, it features gacha elements for attack equipment. The game released with 4 worlds, each featuring a different set of series, while more worlds with new series are added periodically.

It has made SRW history by featuring the series' first instances of cross-series pilot swapping. In order, the Crossing Pilot events are as follows:
* [[Char's Counterattack]] x [[Mazinger Z]] - [[Amuro Ray]] pilots [[Mazinger Z (mecha)|]].
* [[Code Geass]] x [[Gundam Wing: Endless Waltz]] - [[Lelouch Vi Britannia]] pilots [[Wing Gundam Zero Rebellion]].
* [[Super Robot Wars Original Generation]] x [[Seisenshi Dunbine]] - [[Masaki Andoh]] pilots [[Billbine]].
* [[Full Metal Panic!]] x [[Choudenji Machine Voltes V]] - [[Sagara Sousuke]] pilots [[Voltes V (mecha)|]].
* [[Aoki Ryuusei SPT Layzner]] x [[Soukou Kihei VOTOMS]] - [[Asuka Eiji]] pilots a [[Scopedog eiji custom|custom Scopedog]].

title: super_robot_wars_z3
body:
The third and final installment in the [[Super Robot Wars Z]] trilogy. Released on [[PlayStation 3]] and [[PlayStation Vita]], Z3 marks the first HD release in the SRW series. Like it's [[super robot wars z2|predecessor]], Z3 was released in two parts, the first (Jigoku-hen) in 2014 and the second (Tengoku-hen) in 2015. A third segment (Rengoku-hen) was available for a limited time through redemption codes included in first print copies of Tengoku-hen. This third segment is set between the two main games, and focuses primarily on the original aspects of the story.

Despite the graphical update, the Z3 games have faced criticism from fans due to many units and series being cut from the previous games, and a heavier focus on the original story elements as opposed to series roster's stories. Almost every series that debuted in the first game was notably absent in this entry.

title: wing_gundam_zero_rebellion
body: A variant of the [[Wing Gundam Zero Custom]] that was featured in [[Super Robot Wars DD]]'s second crossing pilot event. The event featured a [[crossover]] between [[Gundam Wing: Endless Waltz]] and [[Code Geass]], in which this [[mobile suit]] was introduced as a new unit for [[Lelouch Vi Britannia]]'s use.

title: serpent_(mobile_suit)
body:
[b]MMS-01 Serpent[/b]

A mass-produced heavy assault mobile suit from [[Gundam Wing: Endless Waltz|Endless Waltz]], utilized by the Maremaria army as they put Operation Meteor into action. The Serpent was a powerhouse of a mobile suit, depending on its armament outgunning anything less than one of the Gundams or the [[Tallgeese III]]. It was equipped with missile launchers in its shoulders and could be armed with a beam cannon, a double gatling gun derived from the [[Gundam Heavyarms Custom|Heavy Arms Custom]] and a powerful bazooka.

title: gundam_wing:_endless_waltz

title: banagher_links
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. He first appeared in [[gundam_unicorn|Mobile Suit Gundam Unicorn]]. 

[b]Banhager Links[/b] is the teen pilot of the eponymous [[unicorn_gundam|RX-0 Unicorn Gundam]] and its heavily armed upgrade, the [[full_Armor_unicorn_gundam|RX-0 Full Armor Unicorn Gundam]].

Voiced by [[Uchiyama Kouki]].

title: neck_ribbon
body:
A [[ribbon]] that is tied to the neck in place of a [[necktie]].

Not to be confused with a [[bowtie]], which has more volume.

Not to be confused with a [[ribbon choker]], which is a ribbon tied around the neck as a choker.

title: sunrise_(company)
body:
A legendary [[Japan]]ese animation company. They are mostly known for their [[super robot]] and [[mecha]] shows. Currently under the ownership of [[Bandai]], who acquired the anime studio in 1993.

In February 2022 it was announced that in the beginning of April 2022 that the company would be reorganized and consolidated with [i]Bandai Namco Arts Inc.[/i] and [i]Bandai Namco Rights Marketing Inc.[/i] into the new company [b]Bandai Namco Filmworks[/b], with the name [i]Sunrise[/i] becoming a brand name.

title: futa_without_pussy
body:
Visually similar to [[futanari]] with [[penis]] and [[testicles]] but no [[pussy|vagina]]. That is to say, the character has a female body but male sex organs.

This tag should be used if you can either visually confirm the character has no vagina or there is information that clearly supports that the character doesn't have one, such as the tags used in the source, the artist's [[commentary]] or indicators in the art itself that confirms the character is a newhalf. When in doubt use the [[futanari]] tag instead.

On Danbooru, futa without pussy was previously referred to with the word "newhalf". Newhalf is a Japanese slang word for a pre-op or non-op male-to-female trans person, also referred to as "shemale" (シーメール). The word "newhalf" was originally used for referring a male who had begun to transition to female but kept her lower body the same; literally a "new half". Due to Danbooru's usage of the word not reflecting its real world usage, functionally using it more as a synonym for "futa without pussy", the tag was renamed to use that instead. The fates of the related tags below that still use the "newhalf" name have yet to be decided.

h4. Related tags

* [[newhalf with male]]
* [[newhalf with female]]
* [[newhalf with newhalf]]
* [[futa with newhalf]]

h4. See also

* [[Otoko no ko]] - boys that look very feminine in appearance
* [[Male with breasts]] - boys that have female breasts
* [[Cuntboy]] - boys with female genitalia only
* [[Poison (Final Fight)]] - a popular [[Capcom]] character that became infamously known for her potential status as a transsexual woman, which was left ambiguous by the developers and has remained a topic of frequent debate by fans and media alike
* [[Gender transitioning]] - characters who transition away from the sex they were assigned at birth

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Newhalf":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newhalf

title: iwai_munehisa
body: A character from [[Persona 5]], he serves as the game's Hanged Man Arcana Confidant. In exchange for help running his shady airsoft shop, he provides services to the protagonist such as modifying his guns and discounts on merchandise.

title: yoshida_toranosuke
body: A character from [[Persona 5]], he serves as the game's Sun Arcana Confidant. A washed-up politician who got caught up in a scandal many years ago, he teaches the protagonist techniques to be used when negotiating with Shadows.

title: mother_superior_(diva)
body:
Also known as: Elder Nun, Grandma Nun.

The first of the Little Nuns, she arrived fifty years ago with a dream, a pair of [[duck|ducks]], and a [[Bernese mountain dog]] to oversee the building of the nunnery. Grandmotherly, caring, and respected by all.

* !post #6923270

title: father_(diva)
body:
Also known as: Priest, Padre, Brother Shades.

The only male human known to work at the nunnery, he is often seen to be put-upon and overworked. Despite his stern looks, he gets along with the nuns and seems to enjoy spending time with them (when not watching forlornly from the background). Never seen without his characteristic [[round eyewear|round]] [[sunglasses]].

* !post #6913138

title: pancake_nun_(diva)
body:
An older woman who was the second nun (after [[Mother Superior (diva)|]]) to arrive at the nunnery. She is known for cooking interminable amounts of [[pancake|pancakes]] to feed the other nuns, and is always smiling.

* !post #6906478

title: leaf_nun_(diva)
body:
Also known as: Grey Bangs Nun.

Possibly the only nun in the nunnery clumsier than [[Clumsy Nun (diva)|]], she is often seen getting into various scrapes and accidents, and tends to sport at least one [[bandaid]] on her face. Enjoys [[gardening]].

* !post #6903158

title: bunny_nun_(diva)
body:
Permanently wide-eyed and often seen ominously observing shenanigans from the background. Her [[rabbit hair ornament]] reflects her emotions. Enjoys singing [[Easter]] hymns.

* !post #6899985

title: smug_nun_(diva)
body:
Revels in her rivalry with  [[Strict Nun (diva)|]], in which she tends to come out ahead. She has a [[mole]] under her mouth.

* !post #6889197

title: freckles_nun_(diva)
body:
Also known as: Strands Nun.

One of the older nuns with the least screentime, she frequently appears to [[sweatdrop]] at the others' antics. Something of a clean freak. She has [[black hair]] and [[freckles]].

* !post #6886071

title: star_nun_(diva)
body:
Star Nun is the leader of the older [[nun]]s. She is strict but fair, often doling out punishments to her misbehaving juniors in the form of red star stickers. She was mentored by [[Spicy Nun's mother (diva)|]] during her time at the nunnery, and in turn tends to be a regular minder of [[Spicy Nun (diva)|]] in the present. She has a [[star (symbol)|]] on her habit and commands an army of various birds, recognizable by their identical stars. Prodigious at [[fishing]]. Her [[wimple]] generally conceals all her hair. She has never been seen to open her eyes.

* !post #6882956

title: strict_nun_(diva)
body:
Also known as: Grumpy Nun, Hairclips Nun, Scowly Nun.

While she tries to set a good example for the other nuns, she slips up often and is easily embarrassed. Mentor to [[Clumsy Nun (diva)|]] and long-term rival of [[Smug Nun (diva)|]], she has also developed something of a partnership with the nunnery's [[ostrich]]. She wears two [[hair flower|hair flowers]] and has a [[mole]] under her left eye.

* !post #6876578

title: sheep_nun_(diva)
body:
Sheep Nun is [[Froggy Nun (diva)|]]'s roommate and frequent minder. She bears the shenanigans of her fellow younger nuns with patience and good humor. As her name suggests, she loves sheep. She has [[freckles]] and rarely opens her eyes.

* !post #6865626

title: hungry_nun_(diva)
body:
Also known as: Gluttonous Nun, Sly Nun.

Although her most obvious trait is her love of food and apparent bottomless pit of a stomach, she is also shown to be quite talented at sports. Often seen snacking in the background.

* !post #6855458

title: froggy_nun_(diva)
body:
Also known as: Frog Nun, Curly Nun, Hook-Bang Nun.

An unusual girl with a perpetual [[:<]] face, Froggy Nun loves [[frog|frogs]] above all else, and is owner of a pet frog and several frog plushes. She also enjoys [[banana|bananas]], [[broccoli]], and anything green. Tries hard at all she does and is quick to tattle on others. Close friends with [[Sheep Nun (diva)|]], who acts as a big sister figure towards her. [[froggy nun's father (diva)|Her father]] is a local farmer.

* !post #6853049

title: spicy_nun_(diva)
body:
Also known as: Chili Nun, Half-Bang Nun.

Spicy Nun is known for her skills in art (inherited from [[spicy nun's mother (diva)|her mother]]), her penchant for get-rich-quick schemes (which often backfire), and her love of [[chili pepper|chili peppers]]. Close friends with [[Clumsy Nun (diva)|]].

* !post #6841963

title: clumsy_nun_(diva)
body:
Also known as: Protagonist Nun, Main Nun.

She is the protagonist of the [[Little Nuns (diva)|]] series. As her name suggests, she is clumsy and often unlucky, but nevertheless irrepressibly cheerful. She was abandoned at the nunnery as a baby. Good friends (and often partners in crime) with [[Spicy Nun (diva)|]], and mentored by [[Strict Nun (diva)|]].

* !post #6838662

title: ogiue_chika
body:
[b]Ogiue Chika[/b] is a [[petite|short]], pretty, artistically talented and grumpy female [[otaku]]/[[fujoshi]] character from [[Genshiken]] who [[fujoshi|loves]] to read and draw [[yaoi]] manga.

She has big [[brown eyes]], [[black hair]] and a very peculiar hairstyle (in her earlier appearances) consisting of a paintbrush-like, tall [[topknot]].

Her physical features usually make her the target of the [[loli]] fantasies from most of the male members of the club. [spoilers]Ogiue officially ends up paired with [[Sasahara Kanji]] at the end of the first season of the Genshiken manga series.[/spoilers]

While Danbooru often encourages tagging items with colors, as per forum #130116, ice cream will not have color-related tags due to them being regarded as superfluous and not widely used in tag searching. Please don't create tags for every possible ice cream color.

title: hoshino_ruby
body:
Deuteragonist and one of the titular characters of [[Oshi no Ko]]. She is the [[mother and daughter|daughter]] of [[Hoshino Ai]] and the [[twins|twin]] [[brother and sister|sister]] of [[Hoshino Aquamarine]]. Founder of the new [[B-Komachi (new)|]].

She has [[pink eyes]] with [[star-shaped pupils|a star-shaped pupil in her left eye]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] stylized with a [[one side up]], [[hair between eyes]], [[swept bangs]], and [[sidelocks]].

She is voiced by Igoma Yurie.

title: hoshino_aquamarine
body:
Main protagonist of [[Oshi no Ko]]. He is the [[mother and son|son]] of [[Hoshino Ai]] and the [[twins|twin]] [[brother and sister|brother]] of [[Hoshino Ruby]].

He has [[blue eyes]] with [[star-shaped pupils|a star-shaped pupil in his right eye]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[hair between eyes]] & [[swept bangs]].

He is voiced by [[Uchiyama Yumi]] as a baby & child, and by [[Ootsuka Takeo]] as a teenager.

title: darth_vader
body:
The extremely popular and iconic anto-protagonist and main focus of the [[Star Wars]] films. David Prowse physically portrays Vader in the original trilogy, while [[James Earl Jones]] provides his voice in all of the films and some television series. 

[b]Darth Vader[/b] is a very powerful [[cyborg]] [[Sith]] Lord who wears black [[armor]] and [[cape]]. Once a heroic [[Jedi]] Knight, he turned his back on the Jedi Order, becoming the Right Hand of Emperor [[Palpatine]]. 

In addition to his formidable skill in [[lightsaber]] combat and his power in the Dark Side of the Force, Vader is also a very skilled and dangerous [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] [[starfighter]] ace.

[spoiler]His name before his fall to the dark side of the Force was [[Anakin Skywalker]] and he is the father of both [[Luke Skywalker|Luke]] and [[princess leia|Leia]].

According to Star Wars creator [[George Lucas]], he is the "chosen one" who brought balance to the force by destroying the evil Emperor [[Palpatine]].[/spoiler]

h4.See also
* [[I Am Your Father (meme)]]

title: ireland
body:
An island in the North Atlantic, separated from Great Britain by the North Channel, the Irish Sea, and St. George's Channel. The national symbol of Ireland is the [[shamrock]], and is the origin of [[Saint Patrick's Day]], celebrating the patron saint of Ireland.

h4.See also

* [[Guinness (beer)]]
* [[Northern Ireland]] - the northeast part of Ireland currently governed by the [[United Kingdom|UK]]
* [[Irish text]]
* [[Irish English text]]
* [[Irish flag]]
* [[Leprechaun]]

title: northern_ireland
body:
The northeastern part of the island of [[Ireland]] governed by the [[United Kingdom]].

Historically, the region was separated from the rest of Ireland due to religious and political issues following Irish independence from the UK in 1922, with much of the area's Protestant-majority choosing to remain within the UK instead of joining the Catholic-majority "republican" Ireland. From the late 1960s up until the Good Friday Agreement in 1998, the area saw an era of protracted conflict known as "The Troubles", involving republican and loyalist paramilitary groups and the British government.

h4. See also
* [[Ireland]]

title: yakumo_nami
body:
[[Idolmaster Shiny Colors]] character.

A former [[idol]] with a brief but legendary career. She is [[Ikaruga Luca]]'s mother.

title: ikaruga_luca
body:
A girl from [[Idolmaster Shiny Colors]], a mysterious solo [[idol]] who is not part of 283 Production but rather sees them as her opponent. Considered a god by her fans. Despite her initial hostility, Luca eventually relents and joins 283 Production, initially as a solo idol, before forming [[CoMETIK (idolmaster)|]] with newcomers [[Suzuki Hana]] and [[Ikuta Haruki]].

It is revealed that she is the daughter of the legendary former idol [[Yakumo Nami]].

body: Character from [[Parappa the Rapper]] that eventually got their own spinoff series [[um jammer lammy]]. She is a [[sheep girl|lamb]] girl with [[short hair|short]] [[red hair]]. She typically wears a [[red shirt|red]] [[crop top|cropped]] [[cropped shirt|shirt]], [[jeans|blue jeans]], [[white footwear|white]] [[sneakers]], and a green [[wristwatch]].

title: schneider_(reverse:1999)
body:
Schneider is a character from the game [[Reverse:1999]]. The youngest daughter of a large Italian family, her family immigrated to [[New York City]], USA sometime before 1929. In order to support her family, she join the [[Mafia]] and became a Hitman who is feared by her enemies and respected by her men. She takes an interest with [[vertin (reverse:1999)|Vertin]] who she affectionately calls "My Lord".

Schneider is voiced by Sara Alexander in English and [[Yuuki Aoi]] in Japanese.

The "FGO news announcement":[https://news.fate-go.jp/2023/8th_anniversary_cp/#ttl3] lists it as being her [[Abigail Williams (swimsuit foreigner) (fate)|Summer version]].

Don't confuse this with her regular Foreigner variant's [[abigail williams (fate)|First Ascension]] or [[abigail williams (second ascension) (fate)|Second Ascensions]], nor her [[abigail williams (swimsuit foreigner) (third ascension) (fate)|Swimsuit Foreigner's Third Ascension]].

body:

title: handheld_metal_detector
body:
