title: zwei_association_(identity)_(project_moon)
body: [[list of project moon Identities|Identities]] of [[Limbus Company]] Sinners extracted from mirror worlds where they joined the Zwei Association, the 2nd Association of the city specializing in protection. They primarily wield [[Zweihander|Zweihanders]] or [[greatsword|greatswords]] and wear a [[yellow shirt|yellow]] [[collared shirt]] and [[blue necktie]] under their regional uniforms/armour. The South Section wear civilian clothing of their choosing while working undercover. In battle, they wear outfits similar to riot gear with [[blue coat|blue coats]] with [[shoulder armor]] over a [[black vest]] and [[black pants]]. Some members of this faction use [[baton (weapon)|batons]] instead of swords. The West Section uniform consists of [[yellow shirt|yellow]] [[collared shirt|collared shirts]] with [[blue necktie|blue neckties]] underneath [[blue jacket|blue jackets]], a Zwei Association badge on their left shoulder, and [[breastplate]] with [[gauntlets]] styled after medieval [[knight|knights]]. In combat, they add [[pauldrons]], an [[armored skirt]], [[sabaton|sabatons]] and a [[blue cape]]. h4. Playable Identities: h5. South Section: * !post #7177220: Zwei Assoc. South Section 6 [[Sinclair (project moon)|]] (00) * !post #7172312: Zwei Assoc. South Section 6 [[Rodion (project moon)|]] (00) * !post #7169829: Zwei Assoc. South Section 4 [[Faust (project moon)|]] (00) * !post #7176147: Zwei Assoc. South Section 4 [[Gregor (project moon)|]] (000) h5. West Section: * !post #8238999: Zwei Assoc. West Section 3 [[Ishmael (project moon)|]] (000) * !post #8272689: Zwei Assoc. West Section 3 [[Sinclair (project moon)|]] (00) h4. Non-Playable Identities: h5. South Section: * !post #7177219: [[Don Quixote (project moon)|]] appears in Sinclair's pre-uptie artwork. * !post #7172309: [[Heathcliff (project moon)|]] appears in Rodion's pre-uptie artwork. * !post #7169828: [[Ishmael (project moon)|]] appears in Faust's pre-uptie artwork.

title: triforce
body:
The Triforce is the symbol of Hyrule in [[The Legend of Zelda]] series. The Triforce is split into three different parts, which in the games are always borne by the three central characters of the Zelda saga:

* The Triforce of Courage, which is held by [[Link]].
* The Triforce of Wisdom, which is held by [[Princess Zelda]].
* The Triforce of Power, which is held by [[Ganondorf]].

Whoever possesses all three parts of the Triforce can have any desire that he or she wants granted, but the effects of this wish upon the rest of Hyrule is largely based on whether the bearer of the Triforce is good or evil.

h4. See also

* [[mitsu uroko]] The symbol on which the Triforce was based.
* [[uroko (pattern)]]

title: summer
body:
A scene set in summer, or with a clear summer theme.

Use this tag when the setting (not just a background with seasonal vibes) shows traditional signs of summer, be it:

* [[Hot]] and sunny weather, bright [[day]]s and [[blue sky]]s.
* Light clothing, such as [[t-shirt]]s, [[shorts]], [[straw hat]]s, and [[swimsuit]]s.
* Summer activities, such as visiting the [[beach]], going [[swimming]], going to summer [[festival]]s, cooling the body with [[hand fan]]s, eating summer treats such as [[shaved ice]], [[watermelon]]s, [[popsicle]]s, etc.

title: disney+
body: Disney+ is an American subscription video on-demand over-the-top streaming media service owned and operated by Disney Streaming, the streaming division of Disney Entertainment, a major business segment of the Walt Disney Company. The service primarily distributes films and television shows produced by Walt Disney Studios and Disney Television Studios, with dedicated content hubs for Disney's flagship brands; [[Disney]], [[Pixar]], [[Marvel]], [[Star Wars]], [[National Geographic]], ESPN (Latin America and Caribbean only), Hulu (U.S. only), and Star (outside U.S.) as well as showcasing original and exclusive films and television shows.

A [[Cowboy Bebop]] character.
She wears a powder-blue jacket seemingly affixed to her body, allowing her to show off her midriff and most of her [[breasts]], serving as fanservice to keep viewers at attention. title: lorraine_baines
body: Lorraine Baines McFly is one of the two secondary tritagonists of the [[Back to the Future]] franchise (the other being [[George McFly]]), with her 1955 self as the tritagonist of Back to the Future and a cameo character in [[Back to the Future Part II]], her 1985 self as a supporting character in Back to the Future, a cameo character in Back to the Future Part II, and a minor character in [[Back to the Future Part III]], her 1985A self as a supporting protagonist in Back to the Future Part II, and her 2015 self as a minor character in Back to the Future Part II.

title: jennifer_parker
body: Jennifer Jane Parker is a [[Back To the Future]] character, she is dating [[Marty McFly]]. In 2015 as seen in [[Back to the Future Part II]], they are married.

title: clara_clayton
body: Clara Clayton (portrayed by Mary Steenburgen in both [[Back to the Future Part III]] and the animated series) is married to [[Emmett Brown|Doc Brown]] and is the mother of Jules and Verne Brown.

title: chan_agi
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha|mechaverse]]. She appears in [[Char's Counterattack]] from 1988.

[b]Chan Agi[/b] is a [i]Londo Bell[/i] Fleet [[Earth Federation]] officer and [[military]] assistant to [[Amuro Ray]].

[spoilers]During the final space battle of the film she pilots a damaged [[Re-GZ]] and accidentaly destroys [[Quess Paraya]] in her [[Alpha Azieru]] while trying to protect [[Hathaway Noa]]. Then Chan is herself killed by an enraged Hathaway in a [[Jegan]]. However, it is implied that her spirit survives in the portable "T" shaped [[psycho frame]] unit she had in her belt. Later the glowing device is shown floating in space meaning her ghost somehow helped Amuro stop Axis from falling into Earth.[/spoilers]

title: spike_(bttf)
body:
Leslie "Spike" O'Malley is a [[Back To the Future]], she was a member of Griff's gang in 2015.
She was the first female member of any Tannen gang in known Hill Valley history.

She demonstrated in the Cafe '80s that she could be as tough as any of the guys when she grabbed Marty McFly, Jr. in a very personal place and lifted him up off the floor.

title: buford_tannen
body:
Buford "Mad Dog" Tannen is the main antagonist in [[Back to the Future Part III]].

He was a local outlaw in Hill Valley, California in the year 1885. He was the son of Beauregard Tannen, the paternal grandfather of Irving "Kid" Tannen and Frank Tannen, the great-grandfather of [[Biff Tannen]] and the great-great-great grandfather of [[Griff Tannen]].

title: brazilian_twitter_ban
body:
On August 31st, 2024, traffic to the social media site [[Twitter]] was blocked by telecom companies in Brazil under orders from the Brazilian supreme court.

The ban occurred as an escalation in a months long conflict between Twitter owner [[Elon Musk]] and Brazilian Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes after Twitter failed to designate a legal representative in Brazil. The feud between the two began in April, 2024 when Moraes issued a court order to Twitter to suspend certain accounts for allegedly spreading hate speech and misinformation. Musk later reversed the account suspensions and refused to comply with the court's orders, accusing them of censorship. After the ban occurred, Brazilian users announced their departure as a result of it, and many made their way to [[Bluesky]].

The ban ended on October 8th, after the social network complied with the court rulings, being released gradually.

The timing of the ban happened to coincide with the popular [[Worldwide Miku]] trend, leading to a number of fanart depicting [[Brazilian Miku]] and the effects of the ban.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Brazilian investigation into Elon Musk":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazilian_investigation_into_Elon_Musk]

title: security_checkpoint
body:
A section where security personnel check individuals and prevent them from sneaking in [[weapon]]s, [[bomb]]s, or contraband before entering.

There are two common types:
* The first type of security checkpoint is usually fitted with a [[walkthrough metal detector]] and a [[baggage scanner]], and manned by [[security guard]]s. This security checkpoint is typically seen at an [[airport]], [[courtroom|courthouse]], or a [[stadium]].
* The second type of security checkpoint is usually fitted with a [[boom barrier]], a [[stop sign]], and an armed security. This security checkpoint is typically seen at a [[military base]], border crossing, or any area off to the public.

title: tentacle_and_witches
body:
Tentacles and Witches (テンタクル アンド ウィッチーズ) is a Japanese eroge Visual Novel from Lilith Mist. It was originally released for download July 24, 2010, with later releases of a Package and Playing DVD Edition.

Originally independent, later connected to the same universe as the Taimanin game releases. Playing from the perspective, of the mistakenly cursed Tachibana Ichiro, which was turned into a tentacle monster. The two heroines are the witch [[Futaba Lili Ramses]] and [[Morino Yuuko]].

h4.External links

title: stone_lion
body: Common protective items in traditional Chinese culture include stone sculptures of lions made from stone materials, which have both artistic and aesthetic value. It is common to see a pair of stone or bronze lions placed outside the main entrance of buildings, typically used as protective decorations or ornaments.

title: tobal_no._1
body: Tobal No. 1 (トバル ナンバーワン, Tobaru Nanbā Wan) is a 1996 fighting video game for the [[PlayStation 1|PlayStation]] developed by DreamFactory and published by Square. The game was DreamFactory's first release, as well as Square's first release on the CD-based console. Tobal No. 1 marks Square's first incursion into the fighting game genre, although an adventure-like quest mode is also part of the game.

title: george_mcfly
body:
A [[Back to the Future]] character, he serves as the tritagonist of Back to the Future, a major character in [[Back to the Future Part II]] and a minor character in [[Back to the Future Part III]].

He is portrayed by Crispin Glover in the 1955 and 1985 versions. For the 2015 version and Back to the Future: Part III, he is portrayed by Jeffrey Weissman.

title: biff_tannen
body: "Biff" Howard Tannen is the main antagonist of the [[Back to the Future]] franchise, with his 1955 self serves as the main antagonist in Back to the Future and the central antagonist in Back to the Future Part II, while his 1985 self serves as a supporting antagonist in Back to the Future, a minor antagonist in [[Back to the Future Part II]], and the overarching antagonist in [[Back to the Future Part III]], his 1985A self serves as the main antagonist of Back to the Future Part II, and his 2015 self serves as the overarching antagonist in Back to the Future Part II.

title: data_(bttf)
body:

Data wore a computerized breastplate that could produce certain sound effects — such as a chicken when the gang used this insult against [[Marty McFly]]. His hoverboard was of the No Tech series.

title: griff_tannen
body: An antagonist from [[Back To the Future]], Griff Tannen (portrayed by Thomas F. Wilson in both Back to the Future Part II and in the animated series) is the only known grandson of Biff. He is part of a gang that also consists of [[data (bttf)|Rafe "Data" Unger]], [[spike (bttf)|Leslie "Spike" O'Malley]] and Chester "Whitey" Noguera.

title: mustafar
body:
A [[Star Wars]] planet, [b]Mustafar[/b] is a tiny, fiery planet in the Outer Rim, Mustafar maintains an erratic orbit between two gas giants. Mustafar is rich in unique and valuable minerals which have long been mined by the Tech Union. Its lava pits and rivers make this planet a dangerous habitat; its natives have burly, tough bodies that can withstand extreme heat. The planet became the backdrop for the fateful duel between [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Anakin Skywalker]]. After the rise of the [[galactic empire (star wars)|Empire]], captured Jedi were brought to the volcanic world for interrogation and execution.

H6. Appearances
* [[Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith]]
* [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars]]
* [[Star Wars: Rebels]]
* [[Rogue One: A Star Wars Story]]
* [[Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker]]

title: obi-wan_kenobi_(disney+)
body:
Obi-Wan Kenobi is an American television miniseries created for the streaming service Disney+. It is part of the [[Star Wars]] franchise, beginning ten years after the events of [[star wars: revenge of the sith|Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith]], and stars [[Ewan McGregor]] as the [[Obi-Wan Kenobi|title character]], reprising his role from the Star Wars prequel trilogy.
h4.Plot
After remaining in hiding for the next ten years on the planet [[Tatooine]], watching over Anakin's son [[Luke Skywalker|Luke]], Kenobi is called on a mission to rescue Anakin's daughter [[princess leia|Leia]] when she is kidnapped by the Galactic Empire's Jedi-hunting Inquisitors in a plot to draw Kenobi out. This brings Kenobi into conflict with Vader, who he believed to be dead, forcing Kenobi to face his traumatic past and guilty feelings.

title: icarly
body: iCarly is an American teen sitcom created by Dan Schneider, which originally aired on [[Nickelodeon]] from September 8, 2007, to November 23, 2012. The series tells the story of Carly Shay (Miranda Cosgrove), a teenager who creates and hosts her own web show called iCarly with her best friends, Sam and Freddie (Jennette McCurdy and Nathan Kress) in the apartment loft that she and her older brother, Spencer (Jerry Trainor) live in. As the web show quickly becomes an internet phenomenon, the characters are tasked with balancing their normal teenage lives with the wacky situations their newfound fame lands them in. By the fourth season, their school friend, Gibby (Noah Munck) also works with them on the web show.

title: bandolier
body:
A belt for holding individual rounds of [[ammunition]] or other objects, usually worn like a [[sash]] over the shoulder or chest.

Typically, each round is held in its own loop along the length of the belt. They are often seen on gunslingers in old [[cowboy western|western]]-themed settings and characters, though modern bandoliers exist and may be used to hold [[shotgun shell]]s, [[grenade]]s, or other [[weapon|armaments]].


Not to be confused with an [[ammunition belt]], a device that holds ammunition together to be used on belt-fed [[machine gun]]s.

Also not to be confused with a [[Sam Browne belt]], a similar over-the-shoulder belt once used as a more effective replacement for the traditional "frog" waist belt clip for equipping a sword's scabbard, and primarily an aesthetic feature where it is in use now.

h4. Examples
* !post #376705
* !post #6598468: Another type of bandolier that consists of multiple [[ammunition pouch|pouches]] for [[magazine (weapon)|magazines]].

h4. See also

* [[ammunition pouch]]

title: serial_experiments_lain
body:
A [[cyberpunk]] [[horror (theme)|]] multimedia project including an anime series by Triangle Staff, a [[PlayStation 1]] game by Pioneer LCD, plus a number of soundtracks and artbooks.

By far the most widely known Lain product is the anime, released 1998. The game was released later the same year, although its scenario had been created first. [[Abe Yoshitoshi]] designed the characters for both, and mostly his art can be found in the art books, on the CD sleeves, etc. Various Lain products feature small amounts of [[4koma]] strips and manga pages by ABe, even one nine-page story that makes reference to both the anime and the game.

Due to Serial Experiments Lain's non-linear storytelling (even the anime is divided into "layers" instead of "episodes"), the plot is hard to summarize. Main themes include virtual world vs. reality, communication, loneliness, psychology, parapsychology, cyberculture and theology.

h4. Characters

* [[Iwakura Lain]] (protagonist of both anime and game)
* [[Mizuki Alice]] (aka Arisu; Lain's friend; anime only)
* [[Iwakura Mika]] (Lain's sister)
* [[Iwakura Yasuo]] (Lain's father)
* [[Iwakura Miho]] (Lain's mother)
* [[Eiri Masami]] (Antagonist, anime only)
* [[Yonera Touko]] (Lain's therapist; game only)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Serial Experiments Lain":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serial_Experiments_Lain

title: yume_nikki
body:
A surreal exploration [[horror (theme)|]] game created in [[RPG Maker|RPG Maker 2003]] by [i]Kikiyama[/i]. 

The player wanders around a variety of dream worlds as a little girl, dubbed [[Madotsuki]] by the game menu. The only objective is to search for new "effects", such as a kitchen [[knife]] which one can stab others with, a [[witch hat]] and [[broom]] which can be used to fly, the ability to grow [[cat ears]], etc. The game has no dialogue or story, though it does have an ending which can be viewed when all the effects have been gathered.

On February 23, 2018, a 3D remake/reboot titled was [[Yume Nikki Dream Diary]] released on Steam.

title: possessed
body:
When a character's body is being controlled by other entity that took over their mind, either a [[ghost]], [[parasite]], [[eldritch abomination]] etc..

This is different from [[mind control]] in that possession featuring another person or entity is inhabiting their body and using it as their own, while mind control there they are being forced to do something by an external force that has taken over their mind ([[hypnosis]] or similar). This is usually indicated by a [[different reflection]] in a mirror, their eye color changing, or some other part of their appearance.

title: club_america
body:
Club de Fútbol América S.A. de C.V., commonly known as Club América, is a professional football club based in [[Mexico City]]. Nicknamed Las Águilas (The Eagles), it competes in [[Liga MX]], the top tier of [[mexico|Mexican]] football. The club was founded in 1916, and since 1959 has been owned by mass media company Televisa.
The team plays its home games at the Estadio Azteca, the largest stadium in Latin America and one of the largest in the world.

title: handgun_cartridge
body:
[[Ammunition]] for [[handgun]]s and [[submachine gun]]s. Distinguishable from [[rifle cartridge]] by its shorter size, commonly straight-walled [[shell casing|casing]] and rounded bullet tip. Common calibers are 9×19mm Parabellum, .45 ACP, .357 Magnum and more.

h4. Examples
* !post #6245596
* !post #4740793: Few handgun cartridges have bottlenecked casings, such as 7.62mm Tokarev.
* !post #6173774: Also applicable to PDW rounds that resemble miniature rifle cartridges, such as FN 5.7×28mm.

title: foul_detective_satori
body:
([i]Touhou Chirei Kiden Hansoku Tantei Satori[/i])

An official [[Touhou]] comic published on Comic Walker. The story is written by [[ZUN (artist)|]], with illustrations for the first 11 chapters by [[gin_fragrans|Ginmokusei]] and those after by [[Akimaki Yuu]]. It focuses on [[Komeiji Satori]]'s endeavors as a detective, solving mysteries around [[Gensokyo]].

[spoiler]In actually though, it is a chase after the newly introduced [[Miyadeguchi Mizuchi]], wherein she gets away all the time.[/spoiler]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki":[https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Foul_Detective_Satori]

title: jigokumaru_akira
body:
Jigokumaru Akira (地獄丸アキラ) is a Taimanin of Gosha Village.
The heir of the Jigokumaru family, which is not a Taimanin clan, she is a powerful user of the Darkness Art.
Introduced in [[Taimanin RPGX]] on 11 September 2024. Designed by [[Yuuji (And)]]

title: rape
body:
Forced penetration and other sexual acts on an unwilling participant. The unwilling participant is often visibly unhappy, in [[pain]], distressed, [[crying]], or [[scared]].

Per topic #1489, when a woman is raping a man, use [[femdom]] and [[rape]] together.

The opposite of this is [[happy sex]].

title: shield_wall
body:
A military formation common in ancient and  medieval warfare where soldiers would stand shoulder-to-shoulder and hold their shields so that they would abut or overlap.  While no longer used in military tactics, today it is still utilized by police forces, especially in riot suppression.

h4. See also

* [[phalanx]]

h4. External links

"Wikipedia: Shield wall":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shield_wall]

title: m._bison
body:
[b]M. Bison[/b], known as [b]Vega[/b] in Japan and neutrally referred to as [b]Dictator[/b] to avoid inter-region confusion, is one of the main villains and primary bosses of the [[Street Fighter]] games.

His first chronological appearance is in [[street fighter zero (series)|Street Fighter Zero 2]], as the head of an elusive criminal and military organization known as Shadaloo. Along with his aspirations for world conquest, M. Bison has been working on perfecting a lethal and deadly energy that will exponentially increase his fighting ability, an inherently evil energy he refers to as "Psycho Power".

Throughout the series, M. Bison occasionally attempts to increase his power by transferring his energy form into an artificially created physical body, thus increasing the limit of Psycho Power he can posses. His attempts were usually thwarted due to either the protagonist's actions destroying his physical body, or that the intended new body rebelled against him. His most famous duplicate body is [[Cammy White]].

[[Rose (Street Fighter)|]] is the other half of his soul, spiritually bound to him and wielding Psycho Power's opposite, Soul Power.

Though he has made numerous enemies, his most persistent and personal of foes include [[Chun-Li]] and [[Guile]], both seeking to avenge the death of her father and his friend [[Charlie Nash]], respectively.

After suffering a supposedly final death in [[Street Fighter V]], he mysteriously returned in [[Street Fighter 6]] in a weakened amnesiac form.

h4. Known moves

* [[Psycho Crusher]]
other_names: ベガ(ストリートファイター)

Chuchu is a female [[Pikachu]] with prominent eyelids and a [[hair_flower|flower on her head]].

She is one of [[Yellow (pokemon)|]]'s [[pokemon|Pokémon]] in the manga [[pokemon adventures|Pokémon Adventures]].

In the [i]Gold, Silver & Crystal chapter[/i], she and [[Pika (pokemon)|]] breed a [[Pichu]], [[Pibu (pokemon)|]].

* [[Pika (pokemon)]]

During the [i]Yellow chapter[/i], he stays temporarily with [[Yellow (pokemon)|]].

In the [i]Gold, Silver & Crystal chapter[/i], he and [[Chuchu (pokemon)|]] breed a [[Pichu]], [[Pibu (pokemon)|]].

title: nikaidou_kouhei
body: A [[Golden Kamuy]] character. He and [[Nikaidou Youhei]] are identical [[twins|twin]] [[brothers]]. Over the course of the story, Kouhei has lost both of his ears, one arm, and one leg; he uses [[prosthesis|prosthetic]]s for his missing limbs. [spoilers]Following Youhei's death, he kept one of his severed ears tied to a string around his neck, talking to it as though it were his brother's. He later had it attached to a headpiece by [[Edogai Yasaku]].[/spoilers]

title: nikaidou_youhei
body: A [[Golden Kamuy]] character. He and [[Nikaidou Kouhei]] are identical [[twins|twin]] [[brothers]]. [spoilers]Youhei was later killed by [[Sugimoto Saichi]].[/spoilers]

title: niguredou_julia
body:
A character in [[Mieruko-chan]].

She is classmates with [[yurikawa hana|Hana]] and [[yotsuya miko|Miko]]. Like Miko, she is also able to see ghosts.

She has [[red eyes]], [[blonde hair]] with [[bangs]] stylized in [[twintails]], and [[small breasts]].

She generally wears a [[school uniform]] consisting of a black [[sweater vest]] on top of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[blue necktie]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[skirt]], and [[black pantyhose]].

title: coquelic_(path_to_nowhere)
body:
A playable character from [[Path to Nowhere]], her name derives from the word 'Coquelicot', a name for wild corn poppy flowers and a shade of red. Voiced by [[Ichimichi Mao]] (as M·A·O).

An S rank Sinner, Mentor of the assassin organisation Garden, she is often associated and/or seen with [[red flower|red]] [[poppy (flower)|]] flowers, and always seen [[smile|smiling]]. Her alignment is Limbo.

A woman with [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] and [[red eyes]], wears a large red [[hair flower]] ornament, [[ribbon earrings]] and white [[teardrop facial mark]] makeups.

She is seen only in underwear consisting of [[white nightgown]] [[lingerie]] ([[babydoll]]), [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves]], [[white shrug]] and [[white panties]], the nightgown itself has [[burnt clothes|burn marks]]. She is seen using a [[huge weapon|huge]] narrow bladed [[sword]].

title: guinea_pig
body:
A domestic species of rodent originating from South America, related to the [[capybara]]. The guinea pig is tailless and herbivorous, with a stout, "potato-like" body shape and a size approximately twice that of a common rat. To the uninitiated, the guinea pig may resemble an oversized hamster.

Guinea pigs are highly vocal rodents and are noted for making a characteristic "wheek" sound when excited or hungry. This sound is rendered as "pui" in Japanese onomatopoeia. 

The scientific name of the species is [i]Cavia porcellus[/i]. It is sometimes also called "cavy" by breeders and owners. Guinea pigs were frequently used as experimental animals in research; hence the word "guinea pig" is often also used metaphorically to refer to experimental subjects.
H4. Examples

h4. See also

title: proboscis
body: A proboscis is an elongated appendage from the head of an animal, either a vertebrate or an invertebrate. In invertebrates, the term usually refers to tubular mouthparts used for feeding and sucking. In vertebrates, a proboscis is an elongated nose or snout.

title: youngia
body: Youngia is a genus of Asian plants in the tribe Cichorieae within the family Asteraceae. There are several weedy species in the genus as well as the endangered Youngia nilgiriensis from Sispara in southern India, and Youngia japonica, which is also known as Japanese hawkweed. They appear similar to [[dandelion]]s.

title: ganoderma
body:
Ganoderma（Lingzhi）is a type of dark mushroom, scientifically known as Ganoderma lucidum. It is considered an adaptogen, a compound that can help the body cope with stress and enhance the immune system.

Ganoderma（Lingzhi） holds an important place in the traditional medical systems of several Asian countries, including China, Japan, and South Korea.

title: gundam_tr-1_hazel
body:
A fictional manned combat giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Advance of Zeta]].

[b]RX-121 Gundam TR-1 [Hazel][/b]

A limited production mobile suit developed by the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] for their suppression and destruction of [[Zeon]] remnants. It took many design philosophies from its ancestor, the [[Gundam Alex]], such as purgable armor as well as two large thrusters and defensive features dubbed "shield boosters". It was developed from the [[GM Quel]] and used primarily by the Titans Test Team. In terms of performance it was very in line with another predecessor, the [[Gundam GP-01 Zephyranthes]].

title: jar-jar_binks
body:
Jar Jar Binks is a fictional character of the Gungan race from the [[Star Wars]] saga created by [[George Lucas]]. Jar Jar appears throughout the Star Wars prequel trilogy – as a major character in [[star wars: The Phantom Menace|Episode I: The Phantom Menace]], with a smaller role in [[star wars: Attack of the Clones|Episode II: Attack of the Clones]], and with only a one-line cameo in  [[Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith|Episode III: Revenge of the Sith]].– as well as having a role in the television series [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars]]. The first fully computer-generated supporting character in a live-action film, he has been voiced by Ahmed Best in most of his appearances, who also acted out the character with prosthetics prior to the CGI work.

He was met with overwhelming dislike from both audiences and critics, and has been recognized as one of the most hated characters in Star Wars and the history of film in general, but the character's reception has changed as he has been championed by fans who had seen the prequels at the time of their release as children. He has also been defended by members of the prequels' production team.
other_names: ジャー・ジャー・ビンクス
ジャージャービンクス

title: arlan_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

He is the head of Herta Space Station's security department. With him is a dog named [[Peppy (honkai: star rail)|]]. Voiced by [[Shiraishi Ryouko]]. 

He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] tied to a [[low ponytail]] and with a [[black hair|black]] [[streaked hair|streak]], [[purple eyes]], and [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]]. His default outfit consists of a [[black shirt]] worn under a [[grey jacket]], [[blue armband]] with the Herta Space Station emblem, [[bandages]] on his left arm, [[mismatched gloves|differently-colored gloves]] ([[black gloves|black]] on his right and [[white gloves|white]] on his left), [[blue pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]]. 

He resembles both [[Cyno (genshin impact)|]] and [[Razor (genshin impact)|]] from [[Genshin Impact]]. 

h4. Costumes
* !post #7689935: Splash art

h4. Profile

[expand]
The inarticulate head of Herta Space Station's Security Department.

While scientific research is beyond his understanding, Arlan is willing to risk his life to protect the staff who value research so very much. He is used to the pain and wears his scars like badges of honor.

Only when holding Peppy does the boy finally let down his guard and show a rare smile.
[/expand]

title: hit-girl
body: Hit-Girl (Mindy McCready) is an antihero appearing in the Millarworld shared fictional universe, published by Marvel Comics under the company's imprint Icon Comics and later Image Comics, one of the titular characters of the Hit-Girl & [[Kick-Ass]] franchise. The character was created by artist John Romita Jr. and writer Mark Millar. She is a young and effective vigilante, trained by her father Damon McCready (Big Daddy) from an early age to be a costumed superhero and assassin, introduced in Kick-Ass – The Dave Lizewski Years as a supporting character and ultimate co-protagonist, along with [[Dave Lizewski]].

title: dave_lizewski
body: Dave Lizewski is a simple ordinary [[New York City]] high school student. His mother dies of a brain aneurysm and Dave serves as an anchor to reality for his loving, single widowed father. Dave takes an interest in comic books, which give him the idea to become a real-life superhero dubbed "[[Kick-Ass]]", partnering and later training under Mindy McCready / [[Hit-Girl]].

title: suzukaze_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Suzukaze[/i] in [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]. Character design by [[Amamiya Chiharu]], voiced by [[Taneda Risa]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] dark [[blue hair]] in [[low twintails]] tied together by [[ribbon]]s, and [[green eyes]]. 

Her outfit, a [[sleeveless]] white [[serafuku]], [[black neckerchief]], [[white skirt]], black [[elbow gloves]], and black [[thighhighs]] with a white stripe, is a noticeable difference from the prevailing [i]Shiratsuyu[/i]-class uniforms as historically, she (like Samidare) was built to a modified design that served as a transition to the [i]Asashio[/i]-class. She talks like a stereotypical rowdy Edokko and serves as a foil to the calmer Samidare.

title: samidare_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Samidare[/i] in [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]. Character design by [[Amamiya Chiharu]], voiced by [[Taneda Risa]]. 

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[blue hair]] with a [[gradient_hair|gradient]] (lighter at the bottom) that notably spirals towards the bottom.  She also has [[swept bangs]] and very large [[blue eyes]]. 

She wears a special [[sleeveless shirt]] version of a [[serafuku]] with a white skirt unique to her and her younger sister, [[suzukaze (kancolle)|Suzukaze]]. She also wears [[elbow gloves]] and [[black thighhighs]] to create a [[zettai ryouiki]]. Her [[rigging]] is basic: one 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] to her back and two 12.7 cm twin gun mounts as [[handgun]]s.

body: Character from [[Cowboy Bebop]], Victoria Terpsichore, more widely known as simply "VT" was a well-respected, interstellar trucker with the nickname "Heavy Metal Queen". Her late husband was the famous bounty hunter, Ural Terpsichore, but that was not widely known by others.

title: misha_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A [i][[Honkai: Star Rail]][/i] character, appearing with the 2.0 (Penacony) story. 

A bell boy working for The Reverie in Penacony. [spoiler]His real name was [[Mikhail (Honkai: Star Rail)|Mikhail Char Legwork]], a former [[mechanic]] of the [[Astral Express (honkai: star rail)|]]. [/spoiler] Voiced by [[Matsui Eriko]]. 

He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[aqua hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. His outfit, fitting of his occupation, consists of a [[black hat|black]] [[pillbox hat]], [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], white [[ascot]], [[black jacket]], and [[black shorts]], plus an optional [[pocket watch]]. 

h4. Appearance
* !post #7691447: Base art

h4. Profile

[expand]
"I'm going to work really hard, so I can save up and explore the stars just like grown-ups do!"

A lovable and thoughtful bellboy of The Reverie Hotel. He wishes to become an intergalactic adventurer like his grandfather. He is extremely hardworking and is skilled at fixing a variety of machines. He also had a fondness for sharing interstellar rumors with guests.

He hopes he can grow up faster and looks forward to embarking on his own star-treading journey.
[/expand]

title: opera
body:
Opera (English plural: operas; Italian plural: opere) is an art form in which singers and musicians perform a dramatic work combining text (called a libretto) and musical score, usually in a [[theater|theatrical setting]]. Opera incorporates many of the elements of spoken theatre, such as acting, scenery, and [[costume]]s and sometimes includes [[dancing]]. The performance is typically given in an opera house, accompanied by an [[orchestra]] or smaller musical ensemble.

For the web browser or the personification of the browser, see [[Opera (web browser)]] or [[Opera-tan]].

title: ted_bowder
body: A [[Cowboy Bebop]] character, Ted Bower, more commonly known as the "Teddy Bomber," was an activist and terrorist who used explosive teddy bears to destroy what he viewed as symbols of capitalism.

title: grencia_mars_elijah_guo_eckener
body: A [[Cowboy Bebop]] character, a veteran of the Titan War. After the war, he was tried as a spy and imprisoned. He later moved to Callisto and played saxophone in the Blue Crow.

title: chessmaster_hex
body:
Character from [[Cowboy Bebop]], Chessmaster Hex (チェスマスター・ヘックス,) was a programmer and lead engineer in the Hyperspace Gate Project.

By 2071, Hex had become senile and had forgotten about the plan he created, though he continued to play [[chess]]. He incurred a bounty, though not by name, and several bounty hunters searched for him. Eventually, the crew of the Bebop found him as well as Jonathan. At the same time, Hex was playing a particularly long chess game with [[Edward Wong Hau Pepelu Tivrusky IV|Edward]], who he claimed was the first formidable opponent he had in ages. After he won the chess match that went on for days, he passed away from old age, but as his final opponent was his best, he died a happy man with no regrets

title: mars_(planet)
body:
The fourth [[planet]] in the [[solar system]], located between [[Earth (planet)|]] and [[Jupiter (planet)|]]. The surface of Mars is orange-red because it is covered in iron(III) oxide dust, giving it the nickname "the Red Planet".

h4. See also

* [[Mars symbol]]

title: katerina_solensan
body: Character from [[Cowboy Bebop]], Katerina Solensan (カテリーナ・ソーレンサン) was a drug smuggler and wife of the criminal [[Asimov Solensan]]. Dreaming of leaving the Tijuana asteroid for a better life on [[mars (planet)|Mars]], she instead died in the attempt alongside Asimov.

title: asimov_solensan
body: A character from [[Cowboy Bebop]], he was a high-level member of a crime syndicate and bounty head. He was killed by his wife, [[katerina solensan|Katerina]] while attempting to escape from [[Spike Spiegel]], as he had a bounty of 2.5 million ₩.

title: abdul_hakim
body:
Abdul Hakim is the main antagonist of the [[Cowboy Bebop]] episode Stray Dog Strut. He is a serial pet thief who captured a "data dog" from a group of scientists who were illegally experimenting on it. The dog would later be adopted by Bebop Crew, and was named [[ein (cowboy bebop)|Ein]].

He was voiced by Ryūzaburō Ōtomo in the Japanese Dub and by Joe Romersa in the English Dub.

title: grand_theft_auto_v
body:
Open-world action game developed and published by Rockstar Games. The fifth game in the [[Grand Theft Auto]] series. Originally released in 2013 for [[Xbox 360]] and [[Playstation 3]], 2014 for [[Xbox One]] and [[Playstation 4]], 2015 for [[Microsoft]] [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], and 2022 for [[Xbox Series X]]/S and [[Playstation 5]]. 
Includes GTA Online, a multiplayer open-world action game set in Los Santos before and after the events of GTA V's Story Mode, for playing with [[online character (gta v)|other players]].

* [[Michael de Santa]]

title: michael_de_santa
body:
One of the main protagonists of [[Grand Theft Auto V]], played by Ned Luke.

Formerly [b]Michael Townley[/b], Michael aims to get out of his criminal lifestyle but eventually came back due to his dysfunctional family and a chance encounter with [[Franklin Clinton]].

title: franklin_clinton
body:
One of the main protagonists of [[Grand Theft Auto V]], played by Shawn "Solo" Fonteno.

Franklin's a member of the Chamberlain Gangs Family alongside his best friend, [[Lamar Davis]].

He is also the youngest out of the 3 protagonists, striving to do something greater than doing small-time crimes or jobs.

title: ushiwakamaru_(fate)
body:
A Rider-class Servant, first debuted in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

Typically wears a kanmuri hat, which is tagged as [[tate eboshi]]. Somewhat (in)famous for her [[revealing clothes]] consists of minimal armor plates [[breast curtains|just barely covering]] her [[no bra|bare breasts]] and exposed panties. As such, she is often given a [[black leotard]]-esque undershirt in some later official materials.

[b]True name:[/b] Minamoto no Yoshitsune, one of the most famous warlord from 11th century Japan.
